loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mon, 32, is a farmer from Battambang province. She has two hectares of land where she grows rice and one hectare of sesame. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. She has had this business for 11 years, and she earns about 37,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first time she has borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her past three loans. She used those loans to progressively improve her lifestyle. Now she joins a group of three to get a new loan. She and one other borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each; the third borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash and pesticides, and to pay for labor costs for both of her cash crops. She hopes that she can gain a good output that is better than last year.

loans.use: To buy potash and pesticides, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 33-year-old married man.  He has three children.  He describes himself to be honest and happy.  

He operates a green grocery where he sells bananas, tomatoes and other fruits and vegetables.  He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are individuals.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales.  He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock and sell.  He hopes that in the future he will change his standard of living.  This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, chips, etc. in her general store.

Elsie has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from selling Avon products. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested a new loan to further build her business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, chips, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has been blessed with six children. She lives in a five-bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon. 

Esther has encountered many challenges in life, including the death of her brother, sickness in her family, and inadequate finances. She has been unable to start a business, provide three square meals a day for her children, give her children an education, or provide other basic necessities to her family. 

With this new loan, she plans to purchase seedlings like coco yams, Irish potatoes and maize. She will also buy fertilizer and pay for her farm clearing. She believes her business will succeed because she plans to buy improved seedlings which will lead to high yields, because the soil to be cultivated is very fertile, and because the fertilizer she plans to purchase will greatly enrich the soil. Her longevity in the business has also enabled her to learn some techniques she will apply to get good yields. There is high demand for her products from her neighbors and other community members. With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of her products and at cheaper prices. She also plans to sell some of her products as seedlings to others in the community.

The profit from this loan will help her expand her business, support her husband to provide a better education for the family, and provide three square meals a day to her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment intervals, low interest, and social education they provide. Members are also educated on proper management and marketing techniques before the loans are disbursed to help them avoid mismanagement of capital or wrong investments.

loans.use: to buy farm seedlings and fertilizer, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Narom's Group

texts.en:
Narom is a citizen from the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province.  She is 46 years old and the mother of six children.  Currently, only two children rely on her as they are still in school. 

To tackle the daily cost costing of living, she generates income from both her scarf weaving business and her occupation as a school teacher, which she has engaged in since she was 20 years old.  This is the second loan cycle for Narom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her prior loan has helped her to improve her lifestyle by keeping her kids in school and by enabling her to buy household appliances for her family.  

Now, she joins a group of two to get a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each.  She is the leader of the group. For Narom, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cotton thread to make blankets for retail. She expects that her new business will earn good income to feed the family.

loans.use: to buy cotton thread to make blankets.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Samnang is 30 years old and the mother of two dependent children who are too young for schooling. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava planting.  She can earn additional income via her salaried job during her spare time. She has been with this business for 12 years and it has returned her about 41,600 KHR per day. 

She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before and now she leads a group of four in order to get a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee for her cassava farmland. She hopes her cassava farmland will produce a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee for her cassava farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy is 54 years old.  She is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She has six children, three of whom are in school. To support her living, she grows rice and sells palm fruits to earn additional income. This is the business that she has had for ages and it returns almost 42,000 KHR per day in income. 

Savy has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is a leader of a group of six.  She and her joint borrowers are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fish to make fish paste for resale. She hopes that this new business will generate a decent income to enable her to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fish to make fish paste for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ganimet

texts.en:
Ganimet is a 52-year-old married woman with adult children; she is living in the southern part of Kosovo with only her husband. She is a housewife taking care of the home now that her children are all married and living elsewhere, while her husband is a police officer. 

For a long time now, she has wanted to renovate her rooms but didn't have any chance due to the lack of money. The money that her husband earns is not enough to take care of the renovations and she hesitates to borrow from any of her children, as they all have families that they are providing for. 

The loan will help them to complete their house, and achieve her goal to improve her living standards. 

She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate her house and achieve her goal to improve her living standards

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is married, and a mother of six children. They live in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in living, among which are inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and the ability to cater to her family's needs, sickness and death of family members, accidents involved in by her children and inadequate finances to provide three square meals for her family.

With this new loan requested, she plans to invest in the buying of piglets, feed, farming seedlings, pay laborers to clear her farmland and purchase fertilizer.  She holds a positive view of these businesses succeeding because she has been doing it for long and has regular customers who buy her farm output, and the demand for piglets is high in her area of resident.  In addition, the waste from the piglets is used on the farm as manure to get a high yield. 

With these business activities, the community will benefit from pig waste (manure) which will be used for farming, and she will sell her farm output at discount prices to her community members and ensure regular supplies at all times.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family needs, ensure her children's education, expand her business and also save some to undertake a bigger investment. 

She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also, the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.  The social needs of members are also catered to at GHAPE.

loans.use: Buy piglets, bags of feed, seedlings and to pay for farm clearing

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Herieth is married and a mother of four children, three of whom are in school. Herieth is in her early 40's. 

Since 2005, she has been managing a pharmacy. She is also involved with poultry of local chicken and duck. Her business is open from 08am to 09:30pm daily, and she is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to buy a stock of medicine for her pharmacy. She repaired her pharmacy with new doors made of aluminum, and shelves for medicine keeping. Herieth managed to receive extra income, which she used to buy a farm and covered part of the school fees for her children. 

Herieth is thankful for everyone who has supported her group with the loan. She dreams that one day she will be able to manage her own laboratory. 

She will use this loan to buy a motorcycle for business. She will use it as a bodaboda. 

Herieth will share this loan with her loan group, "KARAFUU", which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for business.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is a hardworking woman who always tries for the well being of her family. She is married, and has three children. She lives with her family in a rural area. 

Gulsara is going to start her own business because she needs to make money. She wants to start a business of animal husbandry because she has a good opportunity to develop this kind of business. 

She will buy cattle, feed them, and sell them in a local market. Gulsara built a cowshed for her cattle in her house some months ago. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, with a woman's organization and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle for start a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan was born in 1992. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband works in a soap factory. Suzan decided to start helping her husband to improve their living conditions by decorating baskets and gifts for special occasions and selling them for the last year. She started her project at her house by decorating a few baskets and trays and found it profitable. Then she started adding more variety to her products. Now she is requesting a youth loan to buy more raw materials that she needs including ribbons and hay to raise her productivity and sales.

loans.use: To buy more materials like ribbons for her business

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 61, is a villager in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province where she resides. She deals with her family’s hardships via a pork-selling business. Her husband also helps to supplement the family’s income via working as a paid-worker at a construction site. She has been with this business for 40 years and it has enabled her to earn about 36,700 KHR per day.  

Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking for the first-time a loan of 400,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more pork for resale. She hopes to earn more income from this business so as she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more pork for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rosa Mirna

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 16 años, 13 años y 10 años y una hija de 11 años de edad. Desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida por medio de la venta de verduras como: repollos, papas, chiles y cebollas. De esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella es una mujer dedicada a su familia y hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar mejores condiciones de vida. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda para lo cual necesitará materiales como: lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Rosa is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her three sons ages 16, 13, and 10 years old and an 11 year old daughter. For quite some time she has been earning a living by selling vegetables such as: cabbage, potatoes, chilies, and onions. In this way she is supporting her home and providing for her childrens' needs. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and does everything she can to provide better living conditions. Her wish is to improve the living conditions of her family so she seeks a loan through FUSAI to invest in repairing her home's roof with materials such as: galvanized metal and wood.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal and wood to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Frida Che

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of nine children. They live in a five-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life including inadequate finances to start up a business of her own to meet her family's needs, sickness and the death of family members.

With this new loan she requested, she will add her profit from the previous loan and invest in the purchase of a car to transport the community member’s farm produce to their various houses, to transport workers to and from work and to transport school children to and from school. She holds a positive view of this transportation business succeeding because she has contacted people who have invested in the business and has acquired the skills needed to undertake such a business. With this business activity, the community will benefit from having transportation available to them.

With the profit from this loan, she will meet her family's needs, ensure her children have an education, expand her business and save some to undertake a bigger investment. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of their low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, the training in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed, and because GHAPE caters to the social needs of the members.

loans.use: to buy a car and pay for the necessary documents

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Originally from province of Kampong Cham, Ya is 41 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids. Only one of the children is still in school and under her responsibility. To make a living, she farms rice. Rice farming is the main source of her income, though she also works as a paid laborer for additional fees. She has been in this business for ages, and it has returned her 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second cycle loan for Ya with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is the leader of her group of two. She and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She hopes her rice will produce a better crop yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Leonardo Lenin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito 5 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive el señor Leonardo, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene hijo. La mujer es ama de casa.
Don Leonardo es un joven que siempre le ha gustado trabajar honradamente para salir adelante, el tiene un puesto en el mercado local en el cual se dedica a la venta de queso y en ciertas temporadas frutas más que todo frutas de la sierra como manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras frutas. Cuando el queso escasea y no tiene muchas ventas el vende frutas y cuando la venta de queso es muy buena solo se dedica a la venta de queso, el realiza esto porque hay que buscar la forma de ganar algo todos los días y así forjarse un mejor porvenir, trabaja todos los días y gracias a esto saca adelante su hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar quesos ya que la venta está muy buena y hay que aprovechar y comprar en grandes cantidades. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permite financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
In the La Paz region in Portoviejo city, known from colonial times as the Royal City of the Tamarindos, every 15 days the members of the De Crédito 5 De Septiembre group meets.

19 year old Leonardo lives in this place, where he is in a civil union but doesn't have any children yet. His wife is a housewife. Leonardo is a young man who has always like to work honorably to get ahead. He has a position in the local market where he sells cheese and during certain seasons seasonal fruit, particularly fruits from the mountains such as apples, grapes, pears, peaches and other fruits.

When the cheese is scare and he doesn't have many sales, he sells fruit and when the cheese sales are good he sells only cheese. He does this because he has to seek a way to earn money every day and in this way provide a better future. He works every day and thanks to this he is successfully supporting his home.

This loan is to buy cheese as the sales are very good and he wants to take advantage of buying in large quantities. He has been in the Grupo De Crédito 2 years and he likes it because the loans enable him to finance his business. His dreams are to have his own home as now he lives in his parent's house.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Chenda is 23 year old. She is a mother of one daughter who is too young for schooling. The main sources of income are from rice farming, grocery selling and cassava planting. She earns extra income via her paid working job. She has been with this business for many years. 

This is the second loan for Chenda and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).The original loan, which she has fully repaid, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, she is the leader of her group. She is seeking 500,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 43, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business processing silver and making jewelry products for seven years. Van is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more silver materials and new tools to make new products of silver to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy silver materials and new tools to make new products of silver.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria habita en la ciudad de chichigalpa desde hace 50 años, es casada y con 5 hijos de los cuales todos ya estan casados, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia contando con una bloquera, nos comentaba que ella se dedica desde muy jovencita a la venta de comida iniciando en su casa de habitacion, ya que ella junto a su esposo tenian que darles estudios a sus hijos para que fueran hombres y mujeres de bien. La señora Maria es una mujer esforzada, con deseos de superacion y emprendedora, prueba de esto es que ella con los deseos que tenia de que su negocio se expandiera, decidio poner su negocio en el mercado municipal junto a sus hijas y nueras, esto con el objetivo de obtener mas ingresos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor vida.
Los creditos han sido de gran ayuda, ya que estos le han permitido invertir aun mas porque ahora aumento la cantidad de platos, ya que la demanda es bastante fuerte. Nos comento que gran parte de su exito se debe a que sus platos siempre cuentan con el mismo sason y la amabilidad con que ella, su nuera e hijas reciben a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria has lived in the city of Chichigalpa for 50 years.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are now married. Her husband is self-employed as a concrete block maker. She states that since she was very young she has been selling prepared food, starting at first from her house. They did this because she and her husband wanted to be sure their children got an education so they could grow up to be good men and women. 

Maria is a dedicated, enterprising woman who wants to improve herself. This was evidenced when she decided to move her business to the municipal market together with her daughters and daughters-in-law so that she could expand, increase her income, and provide a better life for her family.

The loans have been a tremendous help to Maria as they have allowed her to invest even more in her business. Now she offers more dishes as the demand has been pretty strong. She stated that a large part of her success is because her dishes are seasoned with the same kindness with which she, her daughter-in-law and daughters welcome their customers.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying beans, rice and oil.

loans.name: Roeuy's Group

texts.en: Roeuy is 45 years old and a mother blessed with seven children, one of whom is in school. Her entire household solely relies on a single business: 5 hectares of rice cropping.  She has been involved in this business for ages, and it has returned for her almost 45,000 KHR. This is not the first loan for Roeuy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has repaid her past loan wisely to upgrade her living condition to better than before. Now, she teams up in a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She hopes that she can gain a good income, better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Eid

texts.en:
Eid is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his four siblings and his parents. His father is a retired man. 

Eid is a university student majoring in Business Administration and he is in his second year. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation in order to support his family financially because he has noticed a financial crisis, which is not allowing them to be able to pay for his upcoming semester tuition. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester tution

loans.name: Myrvet

texts.en:
Myrvet is a 54-year-old mother of adult children who lives with her husband and her entire family in a village in the southern part of Kosovo. For more than 20 years now, Myrvet has been making and selling handmade craft items in order to earn a living. This particular village is known for their handicrafts and for trading. While she operates her business from her home and sells locally to customers, her husband works in agriculture and receives a pension. 

Business is going very well for Myrvet thanks to the committed effort that she puts into her work. Now she is requesting a loan in order to purchase textile materials to continue to make her items. Her goal is to improve her business and begin her own shop as well as save money. She is very thankful for the help!

loans.use: To purchase textile materials to continue to make her items

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a 23-year-old woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be funny and responsible. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be debts by customers. 

Mwajuma will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live comfortably. She also cooks food to sell to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sovandeth's Group

texts.en:
Sovandeth is a farmer from the Battambang province. She is 25 years-old and is a young mother of two daughters, one of whom is in school and the other who is still too young to go to school. To strive for a better living, she grows cassava as the main source of income. She is now able to generate about 25,000 KHR per day, after being involved in her current business for 8 years. 

This is the second micro loan for Sovandeth and her co-borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before and has helped her keep her child in school. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seedlings and to pay for the plowing fee of her crop. She hopes that she can gain double her previous yield.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pay the plowing fee for her crop

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a farmer from Memoth district of Kampong Cham province. She is 54 years old and blessed with four kids, one of whom still counts on her for support as this daughter remains in school at the university level. For her family, rubber tree farming is the main source of income and sales is the supplementary source of income. This is the second cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Chanta's past loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she has decided to get another loan to cover the tuition fees of her daughter. Her daughter wants to pursue the bachelor degree, majoring in Finance and Banking. She hopes that this financial aid will support her daughter in time so that her daughter can focus more attention on her studies and get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fee of her daughter.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 27 years old and married with one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working for a toy company. Thao earns income through running a general store. 

She started her business six years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a large quantity of basic products, such as foods and beverages, to restock her store. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of basic products, such as foods and beverages, to restock her store

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en: Thol is 30 years old and a villager from the Battambang province. She is married and blessed with three kids; two of whom are in school while the remaining one is too young for school. She strives to make a living via rice and cassava farming. She has been with this business for 15 years. She never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she is a group leader of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings and pay for plowing fees. She hopes this loan will support her cassava promptly with a good yield in return.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Saray's Group

texts.en: Saray is 40 years old and a citizen from Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of one kid who is too young for schooling. For her entire family, cassava farming and paid-working jobs are the main sources of her income. She has been occupied with these activities for ages and it has returned her about 45,000 KHR in income. Including this loan, she and her other two borrowers in the same group of two, are second-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which has been fully repaid, has improved her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is seeking for 1,200,000 KHR, and her joint borrowers are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to purchase seedlings. She hopes that her family's standard of living will be better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and seedling purchase.

loans.name: Chhun's Group

texts.en: Chhun, 45, is a local villager from Kampong Cham province and a mother blessed with two children. One of her children is in school and one is too young for schooling. To cover her family's costs of living, she does cassava farming as the main of income and pig-raising for another source of income. Chhun has been with this business for 25 years and it has returned her around ten dollars per day. She never been with VisonFund (kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is seeking for the first loan and she is the team leader of a group, consisting of two. She and her joint borrower are seeking loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her entire loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland. She hopes that her cassava will produce more yields for her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en el pago de mozos para la recolección de la cosecha y dar mantenimiento al molino nixtamal que posee, le ayudara a dar un buen servicio a sus clientes y tener en menos tiempo cosecha en su casa.
Para Cristina el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar la producción, combatir las plagas,con lo que sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos, sus nuevos ingresos le permiten cancelar sus cuotas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Cristina is requesting a new loan so she can invest it in paying young men to gather the harvest and maintain the corn mill she owns. It will help her to give her clients good service and gather the harvest for her house in less time.

The previous loan helped Cristina to improve her production and fight pests, which made her clients happy. Her future earnings will enable her to pay off her loan and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay young men to gather the harvest and maintain her corn mill

loans.name: Muzafaroy

texts.en: Muzafaroy is married and has 3 children. She always wanted to provide her children with a good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Muzafaroy decided to start a new business. She hopes that her new business of animal husbandry will generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got enough skills in the are of business.  Her children will help her with this business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung, 32, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as an electrical worker. Nhung has been running a general store and business, a room for rent. She started this business eleven years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers as well as build more rooms for renting.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers as well as build more rooms for renting

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Tri is 64 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She  and her husband earn an income through running a food stall to sell breakfast to people in their community. 

They started this business four years ago. Tri intends to take a loan to repair her food stall so that she may better serve her current customers and attract additional customers. 

Tri hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her food stall.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito 5 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 63 años de edad, está soltera y no tiene hijos propios, pero ella crio a una niña desde pequeña la cual actualmente es mayor de edad e independiente.
Doña Mariana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, zapatos, cremas, entre otras cosas, a ella le traen mercadería desde los Estados Unidos, ella sale a ofrecer a sus clientes y también vende en sus casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Lleva  más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salió adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “5 De Septiembre” meet every fortnight in the citadel of La Paz in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known since colonial times as La Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos (The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees).

Mariana lives in this area and is 63 years old. She is single and does not have any children of her own, but she has raised a little girl who is now an independent adult.

Mariana is a homemaker who makes a living by selling products by catalogue, such as clothes, shoes, and creams. They bring her merchandise from the United States and she offers the products to clients. She also sells these products at her house, to which her most regular clients come. She sells her products on credit and she gets paid weekly. She has been doing this work for more than ten years, and in this way she has managed to get ahead in life.

This loan is for purchasing clothes and shoes. She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because the loans enable her to get ahead in life. Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Sorn is 50 years old and a mother of five children. Some have lived separately from her, as they are independent already. To feed her family, she does rice farming and cassava planting as the main source of income. 

Sorn has been with this business for 30 years and it has returned her 40,200 KHR per day. This is the second cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before, especially giving decent food for her kids. Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes to gain a better income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina grows and harvests rice, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works as a driver since it is the only way they have to move the family forward. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she oversees her tenants as well as her crops. 

Adelina is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.  In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She is 44 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. The main source of her income is from rice farming and she earns extra income as a paid worker. She has been with this business for 26 years. This is the second loan for Pov and the third loan for her joint borrower. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to earn a decent income to support her living and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR whilst her joint borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 19-year-old single lady who has been working in the photography business for the last three years. This period has been a good experience for her to develop her skills and make sure she can attract new customers and improve her own business, which she established two years ago. Batoul is a hard worker who is well known in her region from covering almost all of her neighbors', friends', relatives' and nearby villages' special occasions.
Her business is located at home and she is working hard to develop it in the future.

Today, Batoul is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new updated new release camera, which is very important for her business production and development.

Through her future loans, Batoul is planning to establish her own photography studio and work hard on developing her photography skills, themes and services provided.

loans.use: To buy a new camera

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with one daughter, and worked for 26 years before retiring from her job in the financial sector. After retiring, she wanted to contribute to the economy of her family and country, so she began making felt designs, bags, magnets, door decorations, lucky charms and key chains. She sells from her home. She will buy goods with this loan. Her goal is to open a shop in a tourist center.  She also wants to sell her products abroad.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Fatma yapıcı evli, 26 yaşında meslek sahibi 1 kız cocuğu annesi .  Maliyeden emekli  olmuştur.  Emekli olduktan sonra aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlamak istediğinden,keçe tasarım, çanta, magnet, kapı süsü, nazarlık, anahtarlık yapmaya başlıyor.  Satışlarını evden yapıyor. Aldığı bu kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Hedefleri turistlik yerde dükkan açmak. Yurtdışında da ürünlerini satmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Füsun

texts.en:
After retiring from her job at a bank, Fusun began pursuing felt crafting, which she had started as a hobby, professionally.  She isn’t satisfied with the work she has done materially and expects to develop herself in this way, but she is satisfied with herself intellectually.  She makes many handicrafts such as bags, scarves, brooches and keychains. She will buy goods with this loan. Her goal is to open a shop for tourists. She would also like to market her goods abroad.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Bankacılıktan  emekli olduktan sonra, hobi olarak başladığı uğraşı, meslek haline getiriyor.  Yaptığı iş maddi olarak kendisini tatmin etmiyor.Manevi olarak kendisini tatmin ediyor.  Maddi olarak kendisine dönmesini bekliyor.  Keçeden kadın çantası ,şal, broş anahtarlık gibi bir çokel işi yapıyor.  Aldığı bu kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Hedefi  turistik bir dükkan açmak.  Keçeden yaptığı şeyleri yurtdışında da pazarlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Nayoeurng

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Thom province, Nayoeurng is 58 years old and a mother of four children. Currently, one of them still relies on her, as this child is still in school at the university level. 

The main source of income is via her occupation as a construction worker — the occupation which she has been with for ages — and it has returned her $8 USD per day. 

This is the first loan for Nayoeurng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Since she wants to focus on her son’s education, she will spend her entire loan portion to cover the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting. She highly believes that her son will get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for her son

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Chiriku Group

texts.en:
Aisha is aged in her early 20s and is single. For a period of three years now, Aisha has made her living by engaging in a business selling natural medicines and fabrics in the same shop. She starts her business from 7 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Aisha's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to start her fabrics business, and replaced her stocks of medicines. Aisha used her business profit to cover food expenses and also saved for her future. She really appreciates your support. Aisha will use this loan from Kiva to buy new stock of medicines and fabrics for her shop. She dreams to make her businesses successful and own a car. 

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group, "Chiriku," which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stock of medicines and fabrics for her shop

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker for a local company. For 10 years, she has run a business of selling food for people in her community.

Tram would like a loan to purchase better quality food products, such as noodles and meat. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality food products

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 49, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her two daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lan started this business four years ago. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Meet Solomon a well established farmer who lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and 4 children, 3 of which are still in school. He has practiced farming for the past 20 years with his primary income source being milk, tea, and crops. Through his experience in farming, he loves dairy farming the most because its returns are promising and they are received on a daily basis. His major challenge is limited finances which makes him not do to standard farming and this reduces productivity.
Solomon chose Juhudi Kilimo because it deals with small scale farmers like him and this will help him in the way he does farming. During the training, he learnt how to budget and plan his returns so as to grow financially. He says that he is happy to be a part of Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
Maksim lives in the village Gandzakar in the Tavush refgion. He is married and he has three children; two daughters, who are already students and a son who is school-aged. His wife is not employed but at their house he gives services of hairdresser and she has a lot of regular clients. Maksim is a cook and once a year for six months he goes to Russian Federation and works there as a cook and sends good money from there to his family. But during a year Maksim very actively is engaged in farming and agriculture. He has a large land of his own, where he cultivates vegetables and fruit part for sale part for his family use. In his cute farm he breeds two cows, two calves, five piglets and ten chickens. The main products that he sells from his farm are milk, meat and eggs for which he already has many loyal customers.
Makism asks a loan of 3,000 US dollars in order to buy several piglets and a lot of animal fodder, since he wants to start swine breeding also.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Huor

texts.en:
Huor, 43 years old, is married with three children and his wife living with him. They live in the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. To provide for his family’s daily needs, he is in the business of growing rice in his village. He is a very hardworking father, and he always makes sure that he can provide for his family with their basic necessities and afford to send his children to school. He has been a farmer for over 20 years now.

At this time, Huor has applied for a USD 1,000 loan that will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members and to improve his household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Huor is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is young farmer from Hovtashen village. She lives together with her parents-in-law, brother-in-law, husband and three-year-old son.  Her family members work in local companies and work hard to sustain the family's living. Anna herself takes care of the household, her son, and runs a farm. She owns a plot of land where potato is cultivated. She also owns a greenhouse where she cultivates tomato and greens. Anna sells the gathered harvest to local wholesalers from her house. The income from the agribusiness is important for the family's living, so Anna has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. This is her first loan. So it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don't have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Anna hopes that lenders' will support her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en: Lieu, a 40-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She and her husband support their family by running a business selling clothing. Lieu is requesting a loan to expand her business activities by opening a general store in front of her house. This will enable her to sell a range of basic products, such as foods and beverages, to people in the local community and increase her income. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy basic goods such as foods and beverages to sell from her new general store

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is a 39-year-old married woman, who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She supports her family by running a business of making clothing. Oanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more products such as cloth, needles, and thread to make more clothing. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy cloth, needles, and thread to make more clothing.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau, a 32-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She supports her family by running a business of making pillows and blankets. Chau requests a loan to expand her business by purchasing more materials, such as cloth, foam, needles, and thread to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy cloth, foam, needles, and thread to make pillows and blankets.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a farmer. She cultivates wheat, potato, tomato, cabbage and greens. In the greenhouse which she own, Karine also grows strawberries with great love and care. 
The gathered harvest Karine's husband sells in nearby town market so the family gathers income for living. Karine is a mother of three children (ages 8, 6 and 3-years-old) and feels very responsible to gather enough income for their needs. 
By applying for this loan, Karine asks financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to make renovation of the greenhouse. She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 29-year-old single man who works selling and decorating fresh flowers, in addition to providing decorating services for special occasions.

Ziad is well known in his region for the special quality and prices provided, in addition to the special talents in his domain.

He has ten years of experience in this domain, which provides him with customers' trust and improves his business development.

In 2013, he established his current business, and he is working hard on developing and expanding it. That's why he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with productions for special seasons, especially for the Mother's Day celebration which is on the 21st of March in Lebanon, and to buy necessary requested accessories and decorating items.

He hopes to keep on expanding and developing his business by moving to a wider shop. He is working hard to buy his own shop instead of paying rents to others.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with productions for special seasons and buy necessary requested accessories and decorating items

loans.name: Bathany Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Bathany and comprise of six women. On the average, they are 30 years old, with three children. They live in nuclear families in the Dansoman-Accra. They know each other as neighbors and friends and through their work. In order to bolster their financial capacity and better manage their businesses, they have joined the ID-Ghana micro finance institution and are now on their eighth loan. The previous loans have been duly repaid. The group members sell fruits, bags, clothes, and groceries. 

Theresa has been selling fruits for 15 years. She is standing first from the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy apples, bananas, water melons, oranges, mangoes, and pawpaws from the farmers at a reduced price. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash, to mixed clients. She plans to earn a good monthly revenue, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

They will need GHS 6,900 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy apples, bananas, water melons, oranges, mangoes, and pawpaws from the farmers at a reduced price for her fruits and vegetables business.

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak is 48 years old and lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Manushak is divorced and since a very young age she has been taking care of her single son alone. She has no higher education and over the years she did different kinds of work. She was a worker in a factory, and also worked at the kindergarden. For several years she was engaged in a clothes trading business. Now she also has her own small business selling fruit and vegetables at the city wholesale market. 

Manushak’s son also financially supports his mother; with his own car, he gives taxi services in the directions of Kapan-Yerevan-Kapan. Manushak is very proud of her son since he grew up a very kind, decent and solicitous person, and he feels a great responsibility for providing his mother with good living conditions. Manushak asks for a loan of 700,000 AMD in order to organize her son’s wedding party, and to buy nice gifts for her son’s pretty bride and for her beloved son in order to make that day for them memorable and full of wonders.

loans.use: to organize her son’s wedding party and to buy nice gifts for her son’s pretty bride and for her beloved son in order to make that day for them memorable.

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob is 54 years old and lives in Aknaghbyur village in the Tavush region. Serob is married and he has a big, nice family. His two daughters are already married and they live separately with their families. His son still lives with Serob and he does different constructional works in their village. Serob and his wife earn their family living through farming and agricultural activities. They have a rich fruit garden full of fig, persimmon and apple trees, and a vegetable garden where they raise tomatoes, greens and beans. They also cultivate wheat, with which they make flour to use both for their family and to sell. 

Serob mainly cares for their farm cattle. In his farm he has two cows, three piglets and twenty chickens. Serob says that his wife manages to attract many re-sellers who used to buy from their farm meat, eggs, fruits and vegetables - the costs of which are suitable both for Serob and for buyers. Serob now has plans to make both his farm and fruit garden richer. That is why he asks for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD in order to buy a cow, some animal fodder and also several new layers for his fruit garden.

loans.use: to buy a cow, some animal fodder and also several new layers for his fruit garden.

loans.name: Tutel

texts.en:
Tutel is 47 years old and lives in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. He is a very artistic person and he perfectly recites poems and sings very nicely. Tutel has no higher education. For several years he worked as a cook and until now he has cooked very tasty dishes for his family. Then he worked as a driver and now he works as a driver-distributer for the food market. Tutel is married and has a so, who is passing his military service in the army, and a daughter who is already married and lives with her family. Tutel’s wife is unemployed and helps her husband in taking care of their farm cattle and land cultivation. On their large farm they have four cows, three heifers, three calves, three piglets, ten sheep and thirty chickens. The care of these animals demands great efforts and a lot of time, so they hardly manage to overcome that together, but as Tutel says once he decided to become a farmer, he must have a rich and profitable farm. On his land he cultivates potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers to sell.

Despite so much hardship with so many farm animals, Tutel wants to make his farm bigger and he is asking for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy ten more sheep and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy ten more sheep and animal fodder

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en: Maysara was born in 1968. She is married and has two children. Maysara lives in a rural area. She began her own business in animal husbandry because she has always wanted to have her own source of income. She organized this business six months ago. Maysara feeds cows. She buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. Her husband helps her with managing the business. Maysara took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ with a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 550 TJS to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is 63 years old and she lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. She is married and has two sons and a daughter. All of them are already married and only her smallest son lives with Lyudmila. Her son is a taxi driver and Lyudmila’s husband works at the college as a keeper and at the same time, he receives a pension. But there is an occupation in which they all are engaged: farming and agriculture. 

This will be Lyudmila’s second loan from Kiva. She needed the first loan to fence her garden and buy seedlings of orange and fig trees. The garden is already fenced and the layers of orange and fig are already high trees, which finally this year in the autumn season will give a harvest for sale as they planned. In a barn near their house, Lyudmila has two cows, 12 piglets and 25 chickens. They also have a plot of land in a nearby village, Getashen where they established their fruit garden. Lyudmila asks for a loan of 1,200,000 AMD since she also wants to start beekeeping activities. She will buy 20 bee families and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to start beekeeping activities by buying 20 bee families, and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 49 years old. He lives in Ddmashen village, which is in the Gegharkunik region. His large family sends their greetings to Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon and thanks for their first Kiva loan which was rather profitable (they bought young calves) and of great help. Suren perfectly manages his farming and agricultural activities. On his farm Suren raises three cows, four calves, four sheep and twelve chickens. He also continues the cultivation of potatoes and he plans to enlarge it, since he already has a customer who is ready to buy his coming season's harvest.

Suren needs this second loan from Kiva in an amount of 800,000 Armenian drams in order to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and also animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and also animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe studies at the Medical University of Armenia and wants to become a doctor. He lives with his parents in Aragats village in the Armavir region. 

His university studies are very important for Vahe and his family, and he wants to accomplish his goal of becoming a professional doctor. Because of the family's hard financial conditions, he is asking for this loan to be able to pay for his university tuition.

He will be very grateful to lenders if they support his education. He hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 35-year-old married man. He has 10 children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells plates, cups, cooking pans and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cups, plates and other household items for resale. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow. This is his first loan with SMEP-DTM.

loans.use: buy more cups, plates and other household items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, fish, pepper, salt, oil, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business

loans.name: Lorna's Friend Group

texts.en:
Cerelina is the featured borrower of Lorna's Friend group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they arrived to work in Lebanon as housekeepers to provide their beloved families with the necessary living needs and requests.

Cerelina is a 37-year-old divorced mother of three children, who left her hometown and her beloved children in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon as a housekeeper. Cerelina is a beloved mother who is taking full responsibility for the living and education expenses of her children. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to send the acquired amount to her beloved children, to cover their increasing living and education needs.

Cerelina is the first lady from the left. As for the other group members, Genevive is the lady at the center, and Geraldine is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for her beloved children's living and education expenses in their hometown in the Philippines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing such as skirts, blouses and trousers, as well as drinks and snacks for selling on.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a married woman and a mother of four grown children from Baclayon, Bohol. Her husband worked as a driver to support their family. She has a food vending business. She has been selling homemade meals like fish soup, stewed vegetables, fried chicken and others for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income.

Victoriana is asking for a loan to buy various supplies such as seasoning, fish, meat, rice, and soft drinks. With this, she will be able to cook more foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy various supplies such as seasoning, fish, meat, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits will help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros hopes. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed for her business

loans.name: Izaura

texts.en: Izaura lives in Haytagh village with her husband and his family. Her father-in-law works at the local village municipality and the other members of the family are involved in farming. They own a plot of land where potatoes and some greens are cultivated. As that plot of land is too small for gathering a big enhough harvest, Izaura's family also rents some land. Now, so that they can start the cultivation process of that land and purchase potato seeds, Izaura has applied for this loan. It will be a huge help for the family's farming business as it will allow them to continue their successful farming activities.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and the cultivation process

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 34 years old and he lives in Ijevan, which is a city in the Tavush region. Artur is married and he has two sons who are school-aged. He lives with his parents and grandmother. Artur’s father regularly goes to the Russian Federation where he performs different constructional works and transfers some of his earnings to his family members. Artur’s mother works at home where she makes very tasty cakes and different pastries. 

Artur for several years worked at a poultry farm as a delivery person, and then for five years he worked as a driver at a private company. Now with his own car, he provides taxi services. Despite his work, this young man is also seriously engaged in swine breeding and agriculture. In his farm, he has five piglets, 30 chickens, two beehives and a large fruit garden where he has many apple and persimmon trees. His mother uses the farm eggs for her small pastry business. Thanks to his hardworking and active character, Atur manages to have good yield. From his farm, he also sells meat and fruits. Artur wants to enlarge his farm and so he decided to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders.

He asks for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD in order to buy two new pigs and fodder for his pigs as well as chickens for his farm.

loans.use: to buy two new pigs and fodder for his pigs as well as chickens for his farm.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 36-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging from 6 to 13 years old. She describes herself as creative and skilled. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes and onions. Margaret has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are the local community members. 

Margaret describes her biggest business challenge as low sales. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and onions. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a happy life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pepper, fish, meat, rice, oil, etc. to cook and sell soup and rice.

loans.name: Nicolas Fidel

texts.es:
Nicolas de 47 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos menores de edad. Es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por  falta de recursos económicos  no pudo cursar una carrerea, pero le hubiera gustado trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica, la venta de pan, actividad que la de desempeña en una moto el cual es su medio de transporte  El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, en su producto, dentro y fuera de la localidad. A clientes fijos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la reparación de la moto para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, además es su medio de transporte, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Nicolas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 47 years old. He is married and has two minor children. He is from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country. He is described as hardworking, responsible, and eager to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources  he was unable to go to college, but he would have liked to work at an early age. Right now, he fights day to day to offer his children a better future.  

Thanks to his hard work and his eagerness to get ahead, he sells bread as an economic activity. He does this activity on a motorcycle that he uses for transport. He works at his business for 10 hours a day, offering his product, inside and outside of his community to regular customers. The purpose of the loan is to invest in repairing the motorcycle to offer his customers a better service. In addition, it is his means of transportation, and in the not so distant future he can earn better income. Nicolas is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of low income and poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in repairing his motorcycle, which is his transportation for selling bread.

loans.name: Crecencio Hermogenes

texts.es: Don crecencio de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don crecencio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con sus cultivos y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Crecencio is 61 years old. He lives in his own home with his family. He works in agriculture and his main crops are corn and beans. When his harvest is ready he stores it in sacks, as seen in the photo. He sells his products in the buying and selling agencies for basic grains. With the profits he makes, he is able to pay for household expenses. Crecencio is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc. to continue with his crops and to give his family what they need with no limits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Griselda

texts.es: Silvia tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, hija de 6 años y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Silvia se dedica a la venta de minutas (postre preparado a base de hielo, frutas y jarabes)desde hace más de 3 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Silvia desea construir un cuarto dormitorio para sus hijos dado que actualmente todos duermen es el mismo cuarto. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera y de esta forma poder brindar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia.
texts.en: Silvia is 27 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and her 6 year old daughter and 2 year old son. Silvia works selling "minutas" (a dessert made from ice, fruit and syrups). She has been doing this for more than 3 years. She sells as a street vendor in the main areas of her community.  Silvia wants to add on a bedroom for her children, since now they are sleeping in the same room. To do this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheeting and wood so she can offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to add on a bedroom.

loans.name: Arijeta

texts.en:
Arijeta is a 37 -year-old mother of two children living in the southern part of Kosovo. For many years now, she has worked as a hairdresser and has been running her own salon in the area. Currently she needs a loan in order to purchase new tools and equipment that are more updated and of better quality. 

She believes this loan will help her to develop her business and increase her client base even more. She plans on using the income generated from her business to support her family and save for her children’s future. Eventually she would like to expand by opening an additional salon. She is very happy for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment that are more updated and of better quality for her salon.

loans.name: Burim

texts.en:
Burim is a 28-year-old, married father of a one-year-old child. He lives with his family in the southern part of Kosovo, and has been working as an auto- mechanic for many years based on his family's tradition. He learned everything from his father about fixing cars, who was also in this trade for many years. He really enjoys his business and has a large number of customers, requiring him to work from morning until night. 

Burim is now requesting a loan to purchase service parts in order to fix cars. This purchase will help him to provide better service and gain even more customers. He is very happy to have this opportunity and hopes to continue working and growing in his business so that he can improve his income and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase service parts in order to fix cars.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el cada día se esfuerza mucho por mejorar ya que es padre de familia y con el fruto de su trabajo como chofer de mototaxi, puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Carlos está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda Carlos podrá completar el dinero para poder comprar un pequeño auto, con el cual podrá seguir trabajando realizando el servicio de taxi, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder realizar su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the city of Pisco. Every day he puts in a lot of effort to improve his life as he is a parent and, with what he earns from his work as a motorcycle taxi driver, he is able to cover household costs.

Carlos is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, he will have enough money to buy a small car. He will use this car to continue offering taxi services. He can then improve his income and keep on fighting for his great dream: to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is 36 years old and he lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region.  He is married and he has a one year old son.  Harutyun,has worked for several years in different places as a driver.  Now he is a taxi driver at the local taxi service. 

Harutyun works very hard to provide for his young family.  Harutyun now lives in a house which has not been repaired for many years and they live in very poor conditions.  Harutyun asks for a loan of 850.000 Armenian Drams to buy laminate for their guest room, tiles for the bathroom and he also wants to do some electrical work.

loans.use: to buy laminate for their guest-room, tiles for the bathroom and he also wants to do some electrical work

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is a married man.  He has 2 children.  He describes himself to be focused and honest.  He operates a retail business where he offers security services to clients.  He has been involved in this business for 20 years.  His business is located in a busy productive area and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough security tools.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy security tools, i.e security guard baton, boots etc to improve the services offered. His business goal is to expand within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his living standards.  This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy security tools, i.e security guard baton, boots etc to improve the services offered

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su familia, ella tiene un negocio de Venta de ropa usada ó de segunda, en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. Ubicado una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes del lugar. El puesto de ella es muy visitado ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan, la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más fardos de ropa usada y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: This borrower is 24 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has a business selling used and second-hand clothing, offering a variety of items such as skirts, dresses, blouses, trousers and more. The borrower's business is located in an area with many passers-by and she is known by locals. The borrower's stall receives a lot of visitors as people always find what they are looking for, as well as the most important thing: good and friendly customer service. This borrower's dream is to see her business grow and so she has decided to apply for a loan from "Apoyo Integral" in order to buy more bundles of clothing. This will give her a greater variety of clothing items to sell, such as trousers, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, shorts and more. With more clothes, the borrower can attract more customers and have higher sales and a higher income in order to give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: comprar más fardos de ropa usada como faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc.

loans.name: Beronica Del Carmen
