texts.es: la clienta de 25 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas principalmente a la venta de fresas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela que la prefieren por que su producto es fresco y a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fresas por mayor para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente d trabajo y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter in their own home. She sells fruit, mainly strawberries. Her business is located in the market near her home. She has a lot of customers who prefer to come to her because her produce is fresh and at a good price. With the money she earns from her work and the help of her husband they manage to pay some of the household bills.

The client is asking for a loan in order to buy strawberries in bulk, so she can continue her business (since it is her only job) and be able to give her family what they need with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy strawberries in bulk.

loans.name: Edi

texts.en:
Edi lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Edi is single.

Edi joined Ruma one month ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Edi has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $30 per day  in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been cherishing her children by hand-to-mouth. There is only a single earning person who is contributing to the household expenses.

Fozia's husband has been choosing temporary and seasonal jobs, for the time being. Fozia has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto-rickshaw for her husband, so he can have a permanent and constant source of income. Now, she wants to buy a new auto-rickshaw for her husband, but she does not have enough money to buy an auto-rickshaw. 

Therefore, Fozia has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that he will drive the auto-rickshaw with his full devotion and earn sufficient income.

Fozia is a 27-year-old, married woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very happy after taking this loan and she gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto-rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Saffia

texts.en: Saffia is a 58-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been providing services of flour grinding in her community along with her husband (also shown in the photo). They have gained two years of experience in this work and have become known for providing fine quality flour and earn enough to support the needs of their family members. In order to purchase a new grinding machine she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR.  This new machine would help them to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 45 years old. She lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. She has two daughters; her elder daughter is married and she lives with her family, her youngest daughter lives with her and works at a travel agency as a sales manager. For many years Julieta used to work at a carpet factory, but now she has her own clothes trading business. At the local wholesale market she rents a stall and sells men and women's clothes. She gets merchandise from the Yerevan wholesale market twice a month. As she says, her business is a profitable one, and with its income she managed to organize her daughter’s wedding party, paid for her younger daughter’s education, and made minor repairs and furnished her flat.
 
She asks a loan of 1,200,000 Armenian drams in order to renew her spring-summer season clothes collection, with great hope of again having good income from its sale.

loans.use: to buy a spring-summer season clothes collection for her business

loans.name: Sirak

texts.en:
Sirak lives in the village of Aknaghbyur in Tavush region. He is married and has a large family: a son and two daughters. His son works at the military police as a man of duty. For many years Sirak worked as a mechanic, but now he is engaged in farming and agriculture. He also has a tractor of his own, which he uses to do paid agricultural work around his village. He has a cute farm where he takes care of two pigs and thirty chickens. He has a lot of land where he cultivates vegetables (potato, tomato, carrot, greens) and fruits (fig, apple, plum, grape, and pear). On his land he also grows hay, which he sells as fodder for farm animals. 

At this moment Sirak’s tractor is out of order and he is very worried about it. He asks for a loan of 1,200,000 AMD to buy spare parts for his tractor and to repair it, since he must quickly be ready for spring season sowing.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for tractor and to repair it

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Насиба доброжелательная и очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она мать двоих детей, с мужем они давно в разводе. И вместе со своими детьми Насиба живёт в доме своей матери. После развода с мужем, Насибе было очень трудно находить денежные средства на проживание, но она старалась не падать духом. Она смогла самостоятельно воспитать своих детей. Сама Насиба занимается торговлей на местном рынке. она продаёт сахар и разного вида конфеты. От этого бизнеса она имеет стабильный хороший доход.

Сейчас старшая дочь Насибы уже выросла, и она хочет выдать её замуж. В связи с этим Насиба сейчас начала подготавливать все необходимые вещи для приданного своей дочери. На свою полученную прибыль от своего бизнеса Насиба закупила много разных вещей для приданного дочери. Ей осталось купить только мебель, но денежных средств у неё почти не осталось. Поэтому Насиба обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели для приданного своей дочери. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a considerate and very hardworking woman. She is a mother to two children. She has been divorced from her husband for a long time now. Nasiba lives with her children in her mother's house. After her divorce from her husband, it was difficult for Nasiba to find enough funds to live on but she tried her best not to lose heart. She was able to raise her children on her own. Nasiba sells merchandise at the local market. She sells sugar and different types of candy. She has a good, steady income from this business.

Now Nasiba's eldest daughter is already grownup and she wants to get married. In connection with this, Nasiba has now begun gathering all of the necessary items for her daughter's dowry. From the profit she earned from her business, Nasiba bought many different things for her daughter's dowry. The only thing she has left is to buy furniture, but she practically doesn't have any money left. This is why Nasiba turned to Arvand to request a loan to buy furniture for her daughter's dowry. She really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her daughter's dowry.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 33-year-old, married woman, and mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Kalsoom’s son who is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Kalsoom has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000, for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Kalsoom is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare auto parts.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Mahmudlu village. Azer’s family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. Previously he took a loan from Kiva for his agriculture business. He has since changed his business, and now he is a taxi driver. Unfortunately a while ago his car was crashed. Today Azer wants to repair his car and increase the business. Therefore he needs 800 AZN. Azer is a hardworking man, and he hopes that after the repair he will be able to work hard and his business will be better. Azer is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for a loan. He wants to get married in the future.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, slabs, and planks.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 4 years. She works at the market six days a week and sells retail. 

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get enough profit so she can build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en:
Musarrat is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running a business selling milk for the past 5 years. She has two buffaloes for milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing this together to support their family. 

She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. In order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. In addition, it will allow her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sonila

texts.en: Sonila is a 26-year-old single lady. She has been running a business selling fabric for many years. She purchases a variety of fabric from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Sonila requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy different fabrics for the summer season. She will take into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy fabric for the summer season.

loans.name: Ana Clorinda

texts.es: Doña Ana de 67 años de edad vive en casa de su propia junto con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ana es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones,  etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir y así obtener mejores ganancias y tener junto con su esposo y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 67 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She works making and selling clothing. The business is located in her home. Ana is an incredible and exemplary woman as she is very hard-working, responsible and positive. In addition, many people give good references about her character and her work. She sews a variety of clothes at very accessible prices. She also offers quality in her work, which is why many people prefer her. She has been doing this for many years so she has a lot of experience and above all regular customers who prefer her more and more.

Ana has made the decision to ask for this loan through INTEGRAL in order to invest in her small business by buying the necessary supplies such as fabrics, threads, elastic, buttons etc. for sewing a variety of clothes. This will mean she can increase her income and improve her quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, elastic, buttons etc.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Agus is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Agus joined Ruma one month ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Enang has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $2 -3 per day  in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru:
Зоир добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 49 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Зоир живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом. Зоир занимается дехканством и животноводством. Для ведения своего бизнеса Зоир имеет небольшую площадь земли, где выращивает некоторую сельхозкультуру и пасёт своих скот. На сегодня Зоир имеет 2 головы крупно-рогатого скота, которых скоро будет готовить для продажи.

Бизнес животноводства приносит Зоиру стабильный и хороший доход. Он сам любит заниматься своим делом. В этом также помогает ему его жена и дети. Они помогают ему ухаживать и растить скот. Сейчас Зоир желает увеличить поголовье своего скота, чтобы в дальнейшем увеличить свой семейных доход. Поэтому Зоир обратился в Арванд, и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zoir is a good-natured and cheerful man. He is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. Zoir lives with his wife in a small house in a rural village. In order to feed his family, he has his own business. Zoir practices collective farming and animal breeding. For carrying out his business, Zoir has a small plot of land on which he grows several types of crops and grazes his cattle. Zoir currently has two cattle, which he will soon get ready for sale.

The business of animal breeding brings Zoir a good, steady income. He loves doing this business. His wife and children help him with this business. They help him look after and raise the cattle. Now Zoir wants to increase the size of his herd so that, in the future, he can increase his family's income. This is why Zoir is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. He relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Asep is single.

Asep joined Ruma one month ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Asep sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $6 - $7 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en:
Tatul lives in the village Aknaghbyur in Tavush region. Tatul has a big family which consists of his two daughters, his son and his wife. Tatul worked at different companies as a mechanic. Now he is engaged in farming and agriculture, but he also has a second occupation; on his own tractor he does paid work on the lands of his villagers. 

In farming his wife helps greatly and they take care of two cows and forty chickens. For the farm Tatul’s wife sells milk, butter and eggs. Tatul also has a rich fruit garden with a harvest of figs, persimmons, apples and plums, which they sell to re-sellers. As Tatul says, the spring sowing period is very important time for any peasant family.

He is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy tires for his tractor, and he also wants to change his tractor’s transmission box, so that he will keep his tractor in order to be able to do any agricultural work in his farm and by order for his neighbors as well.

loans.use: to buy tires for his tractor and change his tractor’s transmission box

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a 32-year-old married man. He has 2 children ages 5 and 9 years. He describes himself to be committed and goal oriented. 

He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for  year. His business is located in an area suitable for the business and his primary customers are small scale buyers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the 20,000 Kes loan to buy more charcoal for resale. 

His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en: Sonik lives in Vedi town which is in Ararat. She lives with her husband and son. Her husband is a policeman and Sonik herself runs a farm. She cultivates tomatoes and her son sells the gathered harvest locally. Sonik also owns a grape orchard which she takes care of with great love. To tackle financial hardships, Sonik also works at a local bakery. Now, this hard working woman asks for financial support to be able to purchase supplies for renovating her grape yard, such as seeds and fertilizer. The loan will be a huge support for Sonik's farm and she hopes that lenders with support her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for renovating her grape yard such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  is a single mother   of two children and both her children go to school. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for   seven years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis at the market. 

Esther's major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also buying a plot of land and building her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses  include paying rent and   school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 27-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes for sale. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Jajne describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of materials. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 24 лет, занимающаяся бизнесом в своем городе Турсунзаде. Она полтора года назад приобрела точку на местном рынке и занялась продажей женской одежды. Шахноза по сей день продолжает свой бизнес. Она обслуживает каждую клиентку очень внимательно и помогает им с выбором одежды. За короткий период она уже приобрела своих постоянных клиенток. Для развития торговли Шахноза обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет закупить сезонный товар, то есть привести коллекцию весенней женской одежды, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a 24-year-old, married young woman. She does business in her city of Tursun-zoda. A year and a half ago, she bought a stall at the local market and took up selling women's clothing. Shahnoza continues her business to this day. She serves each customer very attentively and helps them with their clothing selection. In a short period of time, she has already gathered loyal customers. In order to develop her retail business, Shahnoza applied for a loan. She wants to buy seasonal merchandise, i.e. bring in a Spring collection of women's clothing, to attract more customers. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase a Spring collection of women's clothing to attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, and milk for her business

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years now. She started this line of work at a young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud of her popularity in her community as being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

To help her to continue her operations, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful of increasing her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Gladys Oneyda

texts.es:
Doña Gladys tiene una edad de 48 años, es una mujer que se dedica a la cría de cerdos desde hace muchos años, ama de casa y madre de 4 hijos quienes ayudan en las diferentes labores a desarrollar en el hogar, entre otras. Doña Gladys cuenta con un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleta ya que por la falta de apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres no pudo continuar quienes son de escasos recursos económicos. Doña Gladys tiene una experiencia de más de 5 años en este rubro, además de ello, ella también se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol. Los clientes para el momento de venta de carne mediante el destazo de cerdos son sus vecinos, familiares, amigos y demás involucrándose únicamente su compañero de hogar.   
Sus metas, sueños para su negocio terminar de construir su porqueriza ya que en su casa de habitación hay un espacio el cual es suficiente para poder llevar a cabo el proyecto. Por lo que hoy en día Doña Gladys solicita pueda ser apoyada para poder comprar concentrado de engorde, así como también comprar instrumentos de destace que ayuden a sacar el corte más preciso.
texts.en:
Doña Gladys, 48, raises and sells pigs.  She has 4 children who help her with the business and with household chores.  Doña Gladys left school early because her parents didn't have enough money for her to continue.  Doña Gladys has raised pigs for more than 5 years.  She also grows maize, maicillo and beans.  Her customers are her neighbors, friends, etc. 

Doña Gladys says that there is space at her house to build a piggery and her goal for the future is to build one.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a feed concentrate for fattening her animals and equipment for butchering them.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her animals sales business.

loans.name: Yonis Lumi

texts.es: Doña Yonis de 43 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hijo en casa propia, desde hace varios años decidió poner en su lugar de residencia un pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos como gaseosas, jugos, aguas, etc. tiene mucha clientela porque el producto es muy vendible y también por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de su ventas logra sacar adelante su hogar, Doña Yonis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de refrescos por mayor para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Doña Yonis, 43, is a single mother.  She lives with her son in a house that she owns.  She decided, several years ago, to set aside a space in her house for a small business.  She sells water, soft drinks, juices, etc., merchandise that sells very well here.  She has many customers who value her fair pricing and friendly service.  Doña Yonis is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with wholesale supplies of soft drinks.  The investment will help her to attract more customers and increase her sales.  Her goal is to raise her income so that she can provide her son with everything that he needs.

loans.use: to stock her soft drinks business.

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush is 60 years old and she is a very clever and successful businesswoman. She lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region of Armenia. She has a son who is married and lives with her. He is a constructor. Sirush’s daughter-in-law works at the school as a teacher. Sirush for some time worked at different workshops and factories as a worker, then she had a clothes trading business, and now she has a food shop of her own. Her shop is located near her house which is very close to the central road of their city. It is greatly visited buy the citizens and passersby, and Sirush is satisfied with her business income. In her shop she sells a great assortment of candies, dairy-products, alcoholic drinks, sausages, etc.

Sirush wants to enlarge and refresh her shop’s food and non alcohol drinks assortment and she asks a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of those products.

loans.use: to buy food and assorted non alcohol drinks for her business

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
Calixto tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad cerca al valle de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores pavos, gallinas y cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Calixto is 50 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Cayaltí, a community near the Zaña Valley. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Calixto and his wife raise small animals such as turkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs. His business is located in an area behind his house. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for fattening his animals. This will enable him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda lives in Argina village with her husband and three children. Her elder daughter works at a local village school and her husband is employed in a private company.

Seda herself runs a small farm. It includes cows, calves and piglets. The livestock that she keeps help her to earn some stable income during the month and cover her family's basic needs. 

Now, Seda is asking for this loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase two oxen and forage for the livestock. The loan will help Seda to enlarge her farm and enrich her. Seda and her whole family hope for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and oil.

loans.name: Marleny Noemy

texts.es: Marleny de 34 años de edad, desde hace 4 años posee en su lugar de residencia una pequeña tienda donde vende diferentes artículos  posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y la atención que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive ne casa propia con su hija de 4 años de edad, Marleny esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, etc. todo por mayor para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Marleny, 34, set aside space in her house 4 years ago for a corner shop where she sells the everyday products that her neighbors want.  Her customers buy from her because she has a good range of products and provides good, friendly service.  Her income from the business covers the costs of supporting her and her 4-year old daughter.  Marleny is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her store with the products she sells: soft drinks, snacks, baked goods, grains, cooking oil, sugar, etc.  The investment will allow her to buy bulk supplies of the products at a better unit price.  Her goal for the business is to generate an income that will allow her to buy whatever her daughter needs.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба милая женщина из Худжанда. - Она работает в продуктовом магазине. Ей 39 лет. Она любит радовать глаза покупателей своим высококачественным товаром. Матлуба продает персики, абрикосы, яблоки, груши, гранаты, киви, бананы и другие овощи. Вставая рано утром, она идет за новым товаром, чтобы фрукты на прилавке оказались во время на месте. Матлуба пунктуальная и не заставит своих клиентов ждать. Уже весна на дворе и настало время для сбора весеннего урожая. Средства кредита пойдут на приобретения весенних плодов и пополнения своих запасов. Она верит, что с увеличением количество и ассортимента товара спрос на ее продукты тоже увеличиться. Поддержите Матлубу.
texts.en: Matluba is a nice woman from Khujand. She works in a grocery store. She is 39 years old. She loves to delight her customers with her high-quality merchandise. Matluba sells peaches, apricots, apples, pears, pomegranates, kiwis, bananas and different types of vegetables.  Getting up early in the morning, she goes after new goods so that the fruit show ups in her stall on time.  Matluba is punctual and doesn't make her customers wait. It's already Spring outside and the time has come to collect the Spring harvest. The money from the loan would go toward buying Spring fruit and replenishing her stock. She believes that by increasing her quantity and assortment of goods, the demand for her produce will also increase. Please support Matluba.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salt, vita, pepper, okra, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fabric, uniforms, etc., for her business

loans.name: Jonatham Jason

texts.es: Jonatham tiene 34 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Managua. Soltero, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Su meta próxima es terminar su carrera. Solicita el crédito para pagar un cuatrimestre de estudio en la universidad. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá terminar sus estudios de manera satisfactoria. Su plan futuro es establecer su propia clínica.
texts.en:
Jonatham is 34 years old and originally from the city of Managua. He is single and a student at one of the universities in the city. His next goal is to finish his degree.

He is requesting a loan order to pay for the next four months of studies at the university. Jonatham believes the loan will be a great help in allowing him to finish his studies successfully. His future plans include opening his own clinic.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies.

loans.name: Dary Luz

texts.es: Dary de 38 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Soledad con su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad y genera ingresos mediante varias  actividades, así vende diversos productos cosméticos, ropa etc., almuerzos y también ofrece el servicio de  alquiler de maquinas para lavar en toda su vecindad.  Su experiencia comercial inicia desde el año 2009 cuando conociendo el oficio de costura de ropa, se dedicó inclemente a él con el fin de generar ingresos suficientes para atender los gastos de su bienestar. Hoy en día su negocio ha crecido y vende de contado y a crédito, con buenos precios pues compra a mayoristas que le ofrecen precios en volumen. En la actualidad Dary ha recibido 1 crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual ha fortalecido su capital de trabajo, logrando a su vez incrementar el volumen de ventas y de clientes. Mu meta y gran desafío es lograr estudios de calidad, para que su pequeña hija tenga mucho éxito futuro. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo, resulta insuficiente para responder a sus planes de crecimiento y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para aumentar la producción de almuerzos,    comprar una lavadora para ofrecer un servicio mas eficiente y con ello lograr el incremento de sus utilidades, en el marco de lograr que su inversión sea muy efectiva.
texts.en: Dary is 38 years old and lives in the town of Soledad with her little one-year-old daughter. She generates income through various activities. She sells various cosmetics, clothing, and more. She also sells lunches and offers the rental of washing machines to her neighborhood. Her experience began in 2009. She knew the craft of sewing clothes and dedicated herself strongly to it in order to  generate enough income to meet the expenses for her family's welfare. Today, her business has grown and she sells clothing for cash and on credit. She purchases wholesale to get good prices and volume. Currently, Dary has gotten one loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which strengthened her working capital which allowed her to achieve an increase in sales and customers. Her goal and challenge is for her young daughter to do well in her studies so she can achieve future success. Her current working capital is insufficient to meet her plans for growth which is precisely why Dary applied for a Kiva loan, her first though Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase ingredients to increase the production of lunches, to buy a washing machine to provide more efficient service, and to achieve increased profits ensuring that her investment is very effective.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and ingredients to make lunches to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a shrewd and hard-working single mother of four children, the eldest of whom is in secondary school. She needs a loan in order to pay tuition and registration fees for her daughter before the deadline. Apparently she is financially constrained because business has been slow. She hopes to repay the loan using proceeds from her business. She is very hardiworking and resilient. Her dream is to see all her children through school.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers, bitterball (a vegetable) and oil.

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en:
Zohrab is a farmer who keeps cows.  He has been in this business for seven years. He is married and has two children. Zohrab’s elder, a son, studies in the first course of college; his daughter is going to music school and plays the piano. His lovely wife helps Zohrab on family business. They are living at Boyuk Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region, but they are an IDP, Internally Displaced Persons, from the occupied territory of Fuzuli city. 

Today Zohrab needs a loan in the amount of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy hay and straw for his cows and vaccinate them. In the future he wants to repair his stall for the cows.

loans.use: to buy hay and straw for his cows and vaccinate them

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir has a market where he sells food products. He is 40 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. The elder of his children is going to the eleventh year class and is preparing  for University. The other child who is school age is in the ninth year class.  They are living in the Fuzuli region, but Mahir’s family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city.  

It’s noted that Mahir has a market and today he wants to increase his business. Mahir wants to buy a fridge for his store. For this reason he needs a loan in amount of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Mahir is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for his store

loans.name: Zarik

texts.en:
Zarik lives in Pshatavan village with her father, mother, sister, brother and 3-years-old child. The family is involved in agriculture. They run a farm and keep livestock. For her family, agriculture is the only source of income and that's the reason they work hard to make the farm more profitable. Zarik has now applied for a loan of 2,000 USD to be able to renovate her greenhouse and purchase some fertilizer for land cultivation. The loan will be a huge support for this woman and her whole family. 

This is Zarik's second loan. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Zarik has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for land cultiivation and to pay for renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: José tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. José se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace más de 13 años. De esta forma se gana la vida y junto a su esposa llevan la responsabilidad de su hogar. José es un hombre responsable y dedicado a su familia y desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual se ha decidido a tomar un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de división,repellar las paredes de la sala y encementar el piso de la vivienda para lo cual necesitará material como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y grava. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder proceder a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en: José, 53, lives in a house that he owns with his wife and two children.  He has earned a living providing security services for more than 13 years.  His and his wife's income together cover the family's expenses.   José loves his family and wants to provide them with a decent place to live.  He is applying to FUSAI for a loan that he will use to repair and improve the family house.  He wants to build an outside wall, plaster inside walls and lay a cement floor.  He will use money from the loan to pay for the materials he needs: bricks, cement, sand, iron bar, gravel, etc.  He hopes to get the loan so that he can go ahead with the work.

loans.use: to pay for house repairs and improvement.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old married man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his wife and his parents in a humble house.  Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector for a very low wage. He also opened a small barber shop two years ago. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and beauty products he uses daily in his barber shop. By taking this loan, he will be able to improve his business and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo taken while he was working.

loans.use: to buy new tools and beauty products he uses daily in his barber shop.

loans.name: Hop

texts.en:
Hop, 55, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a trader.

Hop has been running a  electrical goods shop in front of her house for nineteen years. She sells home electrical appliances to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different sorts of products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more different electrical goods

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en: Nguyet is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goods, such as food and beverages, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene una panadería donde ofrece diversos productos como pan, biscochos, empanadas, champitas y dulcería en general, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, pero también reparte a los caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos sacos de harina, azúcar, polvo de hornear y frutilla y de esta manera elaborar mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 48 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of San Felipe. This community engages in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. The area is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Teófilo has a bakery where he offers different products such as bread, pastries, empanadas, layer cakes, and sweets in general. His business is located in his home, but he also delivers his products to neighborhing villages. Teófilo is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN so that he can buy supplies such as sacks of flour, sugar, baking powder, and strawberries. This will allow him to make a larger quantity of products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, baking powder, strawberries, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sandra De Jesus

texts.es: Sandra tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 9 años y 8 años de edad. Sandra se gana la vida mediante la venta de tortillas, negocio que estableció desde hace más de 3 años de edad. Sandra desea  construir un cuarto pequeño para sus hijos para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro y pagar la mano de obra por la construcción. De esta forma espera poder dar a sus hijos condiciones más cómodas y seguras.
texts.en: Sandra, 31, lives in a house she owns with her two children, 9- and 8-years old, respectively.  She has operated a food business for 3 years, making and selling tortillas.  Sandra is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to add a small room to her house.  She will use money from the loan to pay for the labor and materials--bricks, sand, iron bar--she needs for the project.  She is building the room for her children and hopes it will provide them with a safe, comfortable space of their own.

loans.use: to pay for house repairs and improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used and new electronic items

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a teacher. For 10 years, Lan has run a general store, selling many products to people in her community.

She would like a loan to purchase better quality products, such as household items and a variety of food products. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality products, such as household items and a variety of food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called “Yehowa Akwe”. The group is made up of four members who are, on average, 47 years old, and have two children. They all live in nuclear families in Teshie, Accra. They know one another through business, friendship and neighborhood ties.

In order to strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, the members work with the field partner, ID Ghana. This will be their sixth loan. The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid. The members sell phone credit cards, fish, rice, beans and secondhand clothing. 

Gifty is a smoked fish seller She will use her loan amount of GHS 1,000 to buy three cartons of smoked tuna to sell to customers. She has sold the fish at the market for fifteen years, to various customers for cash. Gifty expects a good profit, which will be invested in her business and used to repay her loan.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,400 to increase their stock.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of smoked tuna to sell to customers.

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina lives in Norapat village with her husband, mother-in-law and two children. Both her children are university students. Tehmina's husband works in manufacturing and makes different furniture products for locals in Armavir town. Tehmina doesn't work as she takes care of the farm which the family owns.

Now, because of financial hardships, Tehmina and her husband have difficulties saving money for their daughter's education so Tehmina is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her daughter's university tuition and will be very grateful to lenders if they support her family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya lives in Armavir town with her retired mother. She is an accountant by profession and is also involved in farming. Ofelya cultivates cucumbers, tomatoes, onions and peppers, and sells the gathered harvest to local wholesalers. She is a very hardworking woman. The farm that she runs isn't very big, but her plans and desires to make it rich are very big. 

She has now applied for this loan of USD 2,500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel and pay land rental costs. The loan will be a big support for her farm, ensuring a sustainable future. Ofelya hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel and pay land rental costs.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a retail business, which she has been doing for four years. 

Beth requested her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy sugar, salt, flour, etc. to add to her stock. She is optimistic that her business will do well. She hopes to improve her business and her family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en: Mushegh lives in Norapat village with his family. He is a furniture maker and works locally. His two children are students in the university and Mushegh and his wife work hard to sustain their living. Mushegh's wife is a Kiva borrower who asked for a loan to pay for their daughter’s university tuition. Now, Mushegh applied for this loan to pay for his son's university tuition. The loan will give this family an opportunity to cover university costs and they will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Tram

texts.en: Tram is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en: Tram is requesting a new loan to buy clothes to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hoai

texts.en: Hoai is requesting a new loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and shampoo to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics and shampoo.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is 41 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family by running a business of making clothing. 

Phung requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more products, such as cloth, needles, and thread, to make more clothing. This loan will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as cloth, needles, and thread, to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with one son and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a security guard of a guest house. For 8 years, Em has run a general store and a sugarcane juice stall.

Em would like a loan to purchase a variety of food products and household items to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet their needs and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products and household items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old, from Naivasha, and is married. They have two children who are 1 year and 6 years old. 

Elizabeth has a mobile transaction business which is locally known as "Mpesa". She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to add more money to the float. Elizabeth will use the profits made from this business to pay school fees for the children.

She hopes to open more Mpesa business places in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: To increase more float for the business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris, from Nyandarua South, is 38 years old and married. They have four children who are between the ages of 22 years old and 15 years old.

Damaris is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on her farm. She is optimistic that her farm will do well after the loan. Damaris hopes to use the profits made to buy a piece of land.

She hopes to improve her livelihood and her family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 43, is married with 2 daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Yen has run a general store for 4 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan  is widowed and has six children, all of them going to school.  She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for seven years. She works in the shop and sells on a retail basis seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and hair shampoo.  Her major business challenges includes on and off electricity and ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda.  She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to have a bridal salon.   She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity bills

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and hair shampoo

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima lives in Mayisyan village with her big family: her parents-in-law, brother-in-law, husband and two children. Sima herself has been running a farm for many years. In particular, she keeps livestock that include cows, pigs, piglets and chickens. She works hard to run her farm in a sustainable way and to gather good income for the family. 

She now asks for this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase 10 more oxen to add to her livestock. This will help her enrich her farming business. Sima will be very grateful to lenders if they support her farm.

loans.use: to pay for 10 oxen.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her mother). She has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for 20 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads. She generates additional income from selling soft drinks like soda and fruit juice. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Florence is hoping to own a tailoring school and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. Now she resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet  is married with six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, beans, rice and cassava. She generates additional income selling bunches of green bananas. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked   restaurant and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas,  beef, beans, rice and cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy twenty sacks of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items including flour, beans and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Santos

texts.es:
Doña Ma. Santos de 33 años de edad es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, madre soltera de un hijo quien está bajo su responsabilidad en todos los aspectos. Tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa la cual gracias el esfuerzo de sus padres quienes le apoyaron en todos los aspectos pudo culminar a pesar de las diferentes dificultades económicas. Ella se dedica a la crianza y engorde de cerdos actividad que aprendió hace más de 5 años mediante capacitaciones impartidas en la comunidad gracias a una institución del área local. Sus clientes al momento del destace son los mismos habitantes de la comunidad involucrándose únicamente un cuñado de ella quien el ayuda al desarrollo de las tareas más pesadas al momento del destace.
Sus planes y sueños hacer crecer su negocio mediante la compra de más cerdos para engordar, mejorando sus ingresos mediante la carne vendida y ayudando a su hijo en sus estudios mediante los ingresos que son generados de este rubro ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de concentrado para engorde de cerdos así como también inyecciones para crecimiento ya que mediante esto su producción dará mejores resultados en los próximos meses mejorando sus ingresos y demás necesidades.
texts.en:
Ma. Santos, at 33 years old, is a persistent and hardworking woman. She is a single mother with a son who is completely under her care. She completed her primary schooling. Thanks to the efforts of her parents, who supported her in all aspects, she was able to finish this schooling despite various economic difficulties. She rears pigs, which she learned over 5 years ago through training events in the community thanks to a local institution.  At the time of butchering, her customers are residents of her community. She helps her brother-in-law in developing the heavier tasks at the time of butchering.

Her plans and dreams are to grow her business by buying more pigs to fatten, improving her income through selling meat, and helping her son in his studies with the income generated from this, as it is her only source of income. For this reason she is requesting financing to buy concentrate for fattening pigs as well as growth injections. Through this, her production will yield better results in the coming months, thus improving her income and other needs.

loans.use: buy materials to rear and fatten pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 37-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She has requested a loan for her husband’s food business.  He sells nimko.  Nimko is popular in the Pakistan subcontinent as well as regions with immigrants from the Subcontinent. Nimko is made of gram flour, spices and salt with other ingredients that vary by recipe. Her husband cooks nimko in a pot in high temperature cooking oil, after this he packs it into the polythene containers and supplies to the retailers. Due to the good taste he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

He wants to offer his product out of a small stall instead of to the retailers, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a wooden stall and more ingredients for making Nimko.

Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a wooden stall, gram flour, spices, salt, etc. Nazia feels proud on her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family.

Nazia wants to save the additional profit amount so that they can utilize these savings for future sudden needs.

loans.use: to buy a wooden stall, gram flour, spices and salt for preparing nimko

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz, aged 48, is a married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband who has only a single source of income.

Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides services to troubleshoot and assemble the bodies of auto rickshaws. He fixes the engines, removes the dents over the rickshaw’s body and renews the paint. Mostly he paints the whole body of the rickshaw for renewal.

His repairing tools have been wearing out over time so he wants to replace them with new ones but does not have enough amounts of money to buy these tools to continue his services. Shanaz has already spent the savings upon the maintenance of his workshop.

Therefore, Shanaz has requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to buy new repairing tools and some additional spare parts for repairing rickshaws.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for repairing rickshaws.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 32-year-old man living in Katito, Kenya. He is married to Evelyn who is a farmer in the same county. They have 1 child who is 7 years old.

He hires out public addresses, a business he has done for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. He is taking his fourth loan of KES 80,000 with Vision fund Kenya, which he intends to use in expanding his business, and will also use part of it to educate his child. The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan and add more share to Vision fund Kenya.

His dream is to be able to extend to other parts of Nyanza.

loans.use: To purchase more public addresses to hire out in functions like funerals,school activity days and weddings, in the region.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates Kiva lenders for their continued support towards helping her boost her business. In addition to the food stall business, Amina sells fruits and vegetables.

She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in Tiribe. For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetables stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

Fatuma requested a loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Bambakashat village with her husband, mother-in-law and three children (ages 22, 20 and 13 years old). The family is engaged in agriculture. As the only source of the family's income, the farming business is highly important for them. 

Gohar has now applied for this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to improve her farm. The loan will be used for purchasing seeds, fertilizer, 5 oxen and forage to feed the livestock. Gohar will be very grateful to lenders if they support her farming business. She hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, 5 oxen and forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase salt, pepper, maggi cub, palm oil, imported oil, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Nancy Sonia

texts.es: Nancy tiene 31 años de edad, es una joven madre con tres hijos en edad escolar todos, se desempeña  en el área legal para una empresa privada. Solicita el apoyo de un primer crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, cemento, piedrines para poder realizar división de cuarto para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Nancy is a 31-year-old mother with three children who are all in school. She works in the legal field for a private company. She is requesting the support of a first loan in order to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, blocks, and stones in order to create a room division for the convenience of her children.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, and stones.

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умиде 34 года. Она живет со своей семьей в районе Спитамен. Ее муж занимается изготовлением таджикских национальных колыбелей и сундуков, а также он является мастером по изготовлению полов и потолков. Умида тоже трудится. Она занимается растениеводством. Умида арендует 0,50 га земельного участка, на котором выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу. А также у нее имеется приусадебный участок земли, на котором выращивается люцерна. Умида решила параллельно начать животноводческий бизнес, так как у нее есть все условия для ведения данного бизнеса. К тому же она имеет опыт в разведении скотов, еще в юности в доме родителей она ухаживала за скотом. Умида в данный момент запаслась достаточным количеством корма для скотов. Она просит кредит в размере 650 долларов США, чтобы закупить четырех голов овец для дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Кредит поможет ей создать дополнительный источник дохода и улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en: Umida is 34 and lives in the Spitamen district with her family. Her husband makes traditional Tajik cradles and chests and constructs floors and ceilings. Umida works hard planting crops. She leases 0.5 hectares of land for planting wheat and corn and has a small garden where she grows alfalfa. Umida has decided to start a livestock business on the side and has all of the necessary supplies. She also has experience caring for livestock from helping her parents when she was young and lived at home. She currently has plenty of feed for livestock. She has requested a loan of $650 to purchase four sheep for fattening and resale. The loan will help her create an additional source of income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy four sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA ont en moyenne  51 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DALLAN l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des légumes et de riz.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont à leur  4ème  prêt solidaire. SAFIATOU 2ème femme   à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 200Kgs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Kotognogotala group are on average 51 years old, have 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in Dallan, one of the neighborhoods of the town of San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

These women met through family ties and are in business buying and selling clothing, vegetables and rice. After having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Kotognogotala group are on their 4th group loan. Safiatou is the 2nd woman to the left in the photo; she plans to use her loan to buy 200 kgs of rice. She gets her supplies locally. She sells to a clientele made up of women and men for cash and often for credit.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA which will be used for the expenses relative to health and school fees and the rest will be reinvested in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Sorany

texts.es:
Sorany, una mujer de 30 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, pues es cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Desde hace 3 años, surgió la idea de montar una sala de belleza en su vivienda, el oficio lo aprendió por medio de una amiga y en el transcurso del tiempo ha realizado varios cursos de capacitación, mejorando sus conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares y brindar educación a sus hijos.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Sorany solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un lavacabezas que le hace falta para seguir acreditando su negocio y mejorar los ingresos que recibe por la prestación de sus servicios.
Sorany sueña con tener su salón de belleza muy bien acreditado para posicionarlo en el mercado y garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita brindar buena educación a sus hijos y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sorany is a 30-year-old mother of two children who she has raised with much effort and dedication. She has been the head of the house since she and her husband separated.

She came up with the idea of constructing a beauty room in her house 3 years ago. She learned the trade from a friend and over time she has taken several training courses, improving her knowledge and perfecting her techniques. In this way she generates the resources necessary to meet familial expenses and to provide education to her children.

In an effort to strengthen her business and provide her clients with a better service, Sorany is requesting the support of a loan to invest in the purchase of a shampoo chair that she needs to continue accrediting her business and to improve the income that she receives for her services.

Sorany dreams of having a well-known beauty salon to position it in the market and to guarantee economic stability that would allow her to provide her children with a good education and to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy a shampoo chair.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. Hang has been running a food stall to earn a living. 

She started her business nineteen years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying new furniture and a variety of different food to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture to expand her business and a variety of different foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Марие 58 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитывает 2 детей. Старший сын - таксист, младший занимается ремонтом автомашин и помогает матери по хозяйству. У Марии - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мария занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,200 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Марии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА на котором ежегодно выращивает картофель для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мария обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мария планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для младшего сына.
texts.en: Mariya is 58 and a widow.  After her husband died she raised her two children by herself.  Her eldest son is a taxi driver.  The younger one repairs cars and helps his mother around the house.  Mariya has a high school education.  As the family's main breadwinner, she raises livestock and grows crops.  She started out 29 years ago by purchasing cattle for 1200 soms.  Thanks to her persistent hard work the farm now has one milk cow, one steer, and two hectares of land where every year she grows potatoes to sell and use within the business.  Her monthly income is 12,000 soms.  To further develop her farm, Mariya has turned to the Bai Tulum Bank for a loan so she can buy steer to increase the herd.  She plans to use income from the loan to invest in further increasing the size of her herd of livestock, and she plans to put away money for her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy steer.

loans.name: Gulgaky

texts.ru: Гулгакы 40 лет, не замужем, живет с братом. У Гулгакы - среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Гулгакы в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается торговлей продуктов питания. В ассортименте: печенье разных видов, конфеты, хлебо-булочные изделия, соки, майонезы и многое другое, начала этот бизнес с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулгакы, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 25,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Также Гулгакы с братом в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимаются животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулгакы в хозяйстве имеется:1 теленок, 10 овец. Доходы от бизнеса и животноводства позволили Гулгакы расширить свой товарооборот и купить автомашину. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулгакы обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку оптовых товаров продуктов питания для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Гулгакы планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем намерена отремонтировать свой жилой дом.
texts.en: Gulgaky is 40 years old, unmarried, and lives with her brother. Gulgaky has a secondary education and has very good references from her neighbors. They speak of her as a kind and hardworking woman. Since 1995, she has been selling food products as the main source of income for her family. Her selection of goods includes different types of cookies, candy, baked goods, juice, mayonnaise and other products. She started this business with initial start-up capital in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulgaky's hard work, she has been able to develop and expand her merchandise. Her business brings in about 25,000 som (KGS) per month,  which serves as the basis for covering her family's food expenses and daily living needs. As additional income for their family, Gulgaky and her brother have also been practicing livestock breeding for many years. They started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulgaky's hard work, she currently has 1 calf and 10 sheep on her farm. The income from her sales business and from livestock breeding allowed Gulgaky to expand her sales volume and buy a car. For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulgaky turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale food products for future retail sale. Gulgaky plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future enlargement of her business. She also intends to repair her house in the future.

loans.use: wholesale food products for future retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is a 43-year-old vigorous lady. She has been running a business sewing belts and trousers with the support of her son (also shown in the photo) for many years. They stitch for the people of their community and also supply the local market. They make a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.
