However, due to the lack of availability of funds, they are unable to meet the daily demands of their customers. For this reason, Sabra requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread, leather and packs of needles. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good credit behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, leather and packs of needles.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 42 years old and married with two daughters. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living casting aluminum and selling it. Lan earns income through running a general store. 

She started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different food products in bulk to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variery of different food products in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children; one kid is too young and fully dependent upon her.

Shama's husband owns a fabric business. His practice is to buy fabrics from wholesalers, dye them into multiple shades and sell them into the market. He has lots of customers who like to buy fabrics from him. Due to new customers, the demand is increasing day by day, but he does not have sufficient capital to buy more fabrics. Therefore, Shama has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand.

Shama is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics from wholesalers to sell to retailers.

loans.name: Marcilio

texts.en:
Brazil's Marcilio is an artist who specializes in hand crafted leather masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather for production. Marcilio has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: "I am a sculptor, art director and teacher specializing in masks. The basis of my formation was architecture, a course where I discovered myself as an artist and from where launched my search as a self-taught creator. My work with masks has its beginning with puppet theaters. I applied the concepts of architecture – that is, the organization of space – to the microcosm of the face. Brazil is a country of racial mixtures with an enormous diversity of human types and archetypes. It is as if all of the masks of the world have passed through here. As an artist, I insist on affirming myself as black, because in Brazil something terrible exists – that is the social invisibility of the African descendant. "I would like to have a good stock of masks on hand. I'll be using this microcredit to purchase a good stock of leather. Thank you for your support." Use the link below to view Marcilio's leather masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4368

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather for production

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Djelibougou dans le district de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djelibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce des condiments (tomates, oignons, échalotes…) et du charbon de bois. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Moussokoro (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (tomates, oignons, échalotes…); Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 corbeilles de tomate, 10sacs d’oignon et 20 sacs d’échalote en gros au marché. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit à Djelibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Moussokoro espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de enfants.
texts.en:
The five women of the Sabougnouma group are married and primarily live in monogamous households. They are on average 48 years old and have 6 children. They all live in the Djelibougou neighborhood in the district of Bamako. They met through neighborhood ties and through their income-generating businesses at the market in Djelibougou. The members of the group are shopkeepers selling condiments (tomatoes, onions, shallots...) and charcoal. With the goal of getting a fresh supply of cash, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 3rd group loan.

Madam Moussokoro (the woman standing to the far right in the photo) has a good reputation in the sale of condiments (tomatoes, onions, shallots...); she plans to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes, 10 bags of onions and 20 bags of shallots wholesale at the market. She resells for cash and credit in Dejlibougou and as an itinerant saleswoman to a mixed clientele. With this loan Madam Moussokoro hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to ensure the care of children.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 30 years old and has three children.  Alma is married and all of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alma has been farming rice for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emerita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and from raising pigs. Emerita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, eggs, etc. for her restaurant business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, eggs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and soap.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emma is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emma has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish for her dried fish business.

Emma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish for her dried fish business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: An $800 loan is offered to Fatima to improve her business. She has a mini -restaurant where many people come to eat every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as Fanta, Sagiko, Coca Cola, Sprite, water, bread, rice, beef, pork and fish. She has been involved in her business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Fatima independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, water, bread, rice, beef, pork and fish

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Germana to improve her business. She is married with five children and opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like cigarettes, milk, sugar, salt, water, oil, bread and noodles. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, milk, sugar, salt, water, oil, bread and noodles

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is married and has two children. She operates a kiosk to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. 

Luciana requested a loan for $800, which she will use to buy stock such as cigarettes, salt, fish, noodles, and eggs. She is a hard working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as cigarettes, salt, fish, noodles, and eggs

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is married with one child, who goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (father). 

She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for two years. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Antoniette

texts.en:
Antoniette is 36 years old, a married mother with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Antoniette has a food vending business in the Philippines. Antoniette requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional bread and ingredients for her burger machine.

Antoniette has been in this business for five years. In the future, Antoniette would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional bread and ingredients for her burger machine.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 63 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, rice, charcoal, shampoo, other groceries, etc. to sell.

Florida has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Florida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, rice, charcoal, shampoo, other groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jamilyn

texts.en:
Jamilyn is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Jamilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell business dealing in charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jamilyn has been in this business for five years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 47 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.  Candelaria works very hard to provide for them.

Candelaria's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Candelaria is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Candelaria has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Candelariais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
Azmat is a 29-year-old lady living with her spouse and two daughters in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. Her younger child goes to school in the morning and for tuition in the evening every day. 

Azmat's husband drives an auto rickshaw. He wants to grow his income so he can easily fulfill the basic needs of his family. He decided to buy an additional rickshaw for giving on daily fair. He has much savings but some amount is short still now. This is the reason Azmat has requested a loan. She has requested a loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy the new auto rickshaw. 

Azmat hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until her children marry. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional rickshaw for transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia est majoritairement composé de femmes  monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou, un des quartiers de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (avocats, bananes Plantain…), condiments et restauration. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des légumes (avocats, bananes Plantain…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 corbeilles d’avocat et 10 corbeilles de bananes Plantain à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux besoins de la famille surtout les enfants dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Siguidia group mainly consists of monogamous women. They are on average 48 years old and have 5 children. They all live in Djelibougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako and met through neighborhood ties. The members of the group are shopkeepers selling fruit (avocados, Plantain bananas...), condiments and doing catering. With the goal of putting together their stock for sale, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 3rd group loan.

Madam Mariam (the woman sitting to the far left in the photo) has a good reputation in the sale of vegetables (avocados, Plantain bananas...). She plans to use her loan to buy 6 baskets of avocados and 10 baskets of Plantain bananas in Bamako. She resells retail at the market and as an itinerant saleswoman to a mixed clientele. With this loan Madam Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business. Her objective is to meet the needs of her family especially the children due to this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Conchita has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Conchita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 50 years old and, with eight children, one of whom is in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ermelinda's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ermelinda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to restart  her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Ermelinda is committed to rebuild and, in the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, toothpaste, soap, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma works hard to support her family. Felma is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business, Felma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell.

Felma has been in this business for five years now. With your help Felma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Марии 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Марии - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мария занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Марии, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2,80 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, сеет зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, а также 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мария обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку семян картофеля элитного сорта для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Мария планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного мероприятия младшему сыну.
texts.en: Mariya is 47 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Mariya has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Mariya practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business 18 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mariya's hard work, she currently has a 2.80 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes every year and sows grains and sainfoin for personal consumption and sale. She also has 1 milk cow, 1 horse and 5 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Mariya turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy a high quality variety of potato seeds for sowing and fertilizers for working the land. Mariya plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to carry out her youngest son's wedding reception.

loans.use: to buy a high quality variety of potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a clothing shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as  shirts, trousers, shorts, children's clothing, long sleeves and short sleeves. She opened her clothing  store a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, children's clothing, long sleeves and short sleeves

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y hermanos. Carlos trabaja en una empresa cercana a su localidad en la elaboración de ladrillo. Carlos es un hombre trabajador y responsable quien desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda dado que no cuenta con un corredor y cuando es tiempo de lluvias el agua se filtra y daña sus pocas pertenencias. Carlos solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada,  polines, pines y para pagar la mano de obra. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Carlos is 24 years old and lives in his own house with his parents and brothers. Carlos works at a brick-making company near his village. Carlos is a hardworking and responsible man who wishes to improve his living conditions. Because he does not have a hallway, when it rains the water filters in and damages their few belongings. Carlos is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, rollers, and pins and to pay for manual labor. He hopes to be able to have access to this funding so that he may proceed with this construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheets, rollers, and pins to build a home hallway.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more  varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Estelita hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 46 years old, a married mother with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dolores has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Dolores has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling jewelry. Virginia is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her furniture-making business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 37 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like gasoline and diesel fuel. She is generating a good income from selling fuel.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel fuel

loans.name: Nyamjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamjargal lives with his wife, son, and one-year-old daughter in Darkhan, city of steel factory. He has been working at a steel factory since 2009. His wife has recently gave birth and stays at home looking after their new born. 

Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house, thus provided comfortable and warm place for his child-bearing wife. Now, he is requesting a loan of 5,200,000 MNT to buy block laying machine in order to start a business. 

If his new business succeeds, it will be lot of help to his family. Also, as it expands, his business may create additional jobs for people. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is aware of his responsibilities and trying his best for his family.

loans.use: to buy a block laying machine.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Progreso” conformado por 07  socios emprendedores y responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Lorenza de 63 años de edad es separada con 11 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Gracias a su trabajo Lorenza ha podido  sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de polos, camisas y pantalones. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. El grupo “El Progreso” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Lorenza es la primera del lado derecho. En la parte superior a lado izquierdo se encuentra Jessica la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the “El Progreso” group.  Is is comprised of seven entrepreneurial and responsible members who look to improve each day.

Lorenza, age 63, is separated and has 11 independent children.  She sells clothes.  Thanks to her work, Lorenza has been able to get her children ahead and improve her quality of life.  She will use the loan to buy polo style shirts, shirts, and pants.  Continuing to work positively is her greatest wish.

The “El Progreso” group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

Lorenza is the first one on the right.  Jessica is shown in the upper left corner because she was not able to arrive on time due to work.

loans.use: to buy polo style shirts, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: María Teolinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
La señora María Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 19, 18 y 2 años, los mayores estudian en universidad y  colegio. Su esposo es chofer de un tráiler.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ganar lo suyo y con sus ganancias ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, Hace dos años ella tenía un centro de llamadas pero cambio de negocio y en el mismo local instaló una farmacia, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 20h00, le va bien en el negocio ya que por allí cerca no hay otra farmacia y por esta razón su clientela es muy buena, además porque ella les da una muy buena atención,  allí también vende colas y helados Pingüino. Lleva 2 años con este negocio el cual le permite ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante.
Este crédito para comprar medicinas de varias clases que le hacen falta. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda para su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son darles una gran educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 'Salud Y Vida" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Charapoto. The city is known for it's traditional culture and also for being minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

María is 45 years old, is married and has 3 children, aged 2, 18 and 19. The oldest studies at university and the next is in secondary school. Her husband is a truck driver. 

Maria is a person who likes to work in order to get what she needs and help her children study with her income. For two years she worked in a telephone center buy she changed businesses in her same neighborhood, starting a pharmacy in her city. She works there every day from 8 am until 8 pm. The business is doing well. As there is no other pharmacy in the area she has a good clientele. She also offers good service and sells soft drinks and  Pingüino ice-creams. She has had this business which allows her to help her husband get ahead for 15 years. The loan will be used to buy various medicines that she does not now have in stock. She is s founding member of the communal bank and she likes it as the loans are a lot of help for her business and her life. Her dream is to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 47 years old and has five children who are in school.

Josephine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

Flordeliza requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, bread, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, bread, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline  tiene la edad de 23 años, es casada y vive con el esposo y  la suegra actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia  a salir adelante. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jacqueline is 23 years old, married and currently living with her husband and mother-in-law. Jacqueline wants this loan in order to buy cattle to sell to make a profit when they are older. This cattle business helps Jacqueline and her family to get ahead. She hopes that, with this project, she will grow and achieve her goals. She can then offer her family a better quality of life and more financial stability. This is Jacqueline's first loan from "FUDECOSUR". She has not had other loans with state banks and "FUDECOSUR" is providing this loan under better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Edelie

texts.en:
This is Edelie, 53, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cristituto, a machine operator, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edelie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Edelie hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams to have a good future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. Leonila is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to resell in her general store.

Leonila has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business to restart her business activities.

Teresita has been in this business for five years, and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand and improve business .

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 44 years old, married, and has three children; two of whom are in school. 

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jonalyn has been farming vegetables for twenty years.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 39 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Pamela's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Pamela is taking out a bridge loan to restart her ready-to-wear business.

Pamela has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Pamela is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save enough money to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Erlinda

texts.es:
Vilma es una joven de 23 años de edad quien es casada y agricultora, madre de 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad. En compañía de su esposo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol trabajando diariamente para poder darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos y un mejor futuro. Además de la siembra de maíz y frijol también cultivan maicillo el su propio terreno por el cual agradecen primeramente a DIOS por trabajar de forma propia y no alquilar propiedades ajenas. La distancia la cual está ubicada su propiedad es de 80 metros desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando para dar asistencia y mantenimiento: preparación de tierra, aplicación de insumos, limpieza de maleza, entre otras. Sus clientes son los mismos habitantes de la zona ya que son ellos quienes sirven como intermediarios en otras zonas aledañas para poder vender su producto. 
Vilma solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y semilla de maíz y frijol certificada para poder cultivar ya que de esa manera ella podrá ampliar su cosecha para esta temporada y mejorar su ingreso de manera que pueda satisfacer las necesidades que en su familia surgen para mejorar su estilo de vida y condición. Sus metas para esta temporada poder obtener mejores ingresos para su familia, negocio, entre otras de manera que pueda ahorrar y en algún momento trabajar con capital propio sin depender de financiamiento de manera que pueda ser auto sostenible su negocio y demás planes.
texts.en:
Vilma is 23 years old, married and works as a farmer. She is a mother to two children. Alongside her husband, Vilma works growing corn and beans. The couple works every day in order to offer their children a better quality of life and a better future. As well as growing corn and beans, Vilma and her husband grow sorghum on their own land. The are thankful to God that they can work independently and not have to rent land. The couple's land is 80 metres from their house and they arrive their by foot in order to look after the crops: the couple prepares the land, applies any products and does weed-killing and other work. Vilma's customers are local people as they work as intermediaries who sell the products in neighbouring areas.

Vilma is applying for this loan in order to buy farming supplies such as certified corn and bean seeds to grow. With this she can increase her harvest this season and increase her income in order to cover necessary household costs and improve her lifestyle and living conditions. Vilma's goals for this season are to increase her income for her family, business and other items. She wants to save up so that she can work with her own capital and not depend financially on others. She can then be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as certified corn and bean seeds to grow.

loans.name: Ma Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, casada y tiene un hijo.Tiene una tienda de Abarrotes desde hace 20 años. Solicita el crédito para hacer mejoras a su vivienda, principalmente a unos cuartos que desea rentar y de esa manera  obtener mas ingresos para su familia.
Sus logros son que a través de su trabajo constante en su tienda, ha dado estabilidad económica a su familia y ha podido ampliar su negocio. Sus retos, por ahora terminar sus cuartos y llevar a cabo el proyecto de poder
rentarlos.
texts.en:
Socorro is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is married and has one son. Socorro has had a grocery store for 20 years. She is applying for this loan in order to make improvements to her home, particularly to a couple of rooms that she wishes to rent out and earn a higher income for her family.

Through constant work at her shop, Socorro has managed to give her family financial stability and has been able to expand her business. Her present challenges are to finish the rooms and realise her plan to rent them out.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María Jesús es una mujer luchadora de 33 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos siendo ellos y su esposo apoyo incondicional en las diferentes actividades de campo entre otras que son llevadas a cabo en el hogar. Ella es agricultora desde hace más de 10 años en la siembra de papa siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana y el producto es comercializado con los compradores que llegan a la zona entre otros. El terreno en el cual ella, sus hijos y su esposo viven es propio gracias a una herencia que dieron sus suegros el cual está ubicado cerca de su casa de habitación permitiendo esto estar más al pendiente de sus cultivos.
Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla de primera calidad y los insumos necesarios que ayudaran a que el cultivo de papa pueda estar fortalecido y muy bien cuidado mediante la aplicación de estos. Sus metas poder cosechar la semilla que comprara, para poder generar mayores ingresos a su familia, incrementar las ventas mediante este logro por el cual pide ser apoyada para poder llevar a cabo para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor y mayor variedad ya que ella tiene muchas esperanzas de ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma Kiva para llevar a cabo sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria Jesus is a persistent 33-year-old mother of 4 children. She gives them and her husband unconditional support in various field activities, among others that are carried out at home. She has been a farmer and has planted potatoes for more than 10 years. Her parents taught her to work in the field very early on and the product is sold to buyers to come to the area, as well as others. The land on which she, her children, and her husband live is their own, thanks to an inheritance given from her in-laws. It is located near her house, which allows her to keep a better eye on her crops.

She is currently requesting assistance to buy the best quality seed and the necessary supplies that will allow the potato crop to be very well maintained and taken care of during implementation. Her goals are to harvest the seed that she purchases so that she may generate more income for her family, and to increase sales. This goal can be supported by offering her customers a bigger and better variety, and she hopes different Kiva investors will support her in reaching her goals.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and certified potato seed to grow.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the products that she needed in her tailoring business. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nimfa hopes to be more successful in business, and dreams that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Josephine requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack foods, canned goods and other items.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, canned goods and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Margaret Corazon, age 57, runs a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, and detergent.

She and her husband have two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Margaret Corazon has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more grocery items to offer for sale in her store. 

Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, and detergent to offer for sale

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with five children. She is a veryhard working entrepreneur. Merlita is 39 years old and four of her children are currently in school.

Merlita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Merlita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Delma has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes like shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Delma has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes like shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Melodeta

texts.en:
Melodeta is 40 years old and has six children. Melodeta is married and has six children who are in school.

Melodeta is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Melodeta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melodeta has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melodeta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 39 years old and a married mother with three children; two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jean has a bakery business in the Philippines. Jean requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

Jean has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, fish, etc. for her business.

Nora has been in this business for 15 years now.

Nora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, fish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and married with two children; both are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rhootcel

texts.en:
Rhootcel is 34 years old and has three children. Rhootcel is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Rhootcel is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Rhootcel requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rhootcel has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rhootcel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru:
Мукаррам жизнерадостная, трудолюбивая, добрая женщина. Мукаррам родилась в небольшом городке и по сей день проживает там. Ей 52 года. Имеет двоих детей. Муж Мукаррама много лет назад умер от болезни, после этого она не создала свою личную жизнь. Сама воспитывала своих детей. Она очень заботливая мать, со всеми силами старается создать детям семейный уют, чтобы дети жили в достатке, не в чем не нуждались и не чувствовали отсутствие отца. Мукаррам для них и мать и отец.
Мукаррам вот уже несколько лет подряд торгует на рынке. Она продает овощи, а точнее лук репчатый. Мукаррам имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Она больше десяти лет торгует на рынке. За эти длительные годы она завоевала множество постоянных клиентов. Как она сама говорит "Благодаря моему небольшому бизнесу я улучшила нашу семейную жизнь и выдала замуж дочку". Мукаррам хотела бы расширить товарооборот, а также увеличить разновидность  ассортимента овощей. Но ей своих накопленных денег не хватает для товарооборота , поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом в надежде что организация не откажет ей и финансово её поддержит.
texts.en:
Mukarram is a cheerful, hardworking and kind woman. Mukarram was born in a small village and lives there to this day. She is 52 years old and has two children. Mukarram's husband died many years ago from an illness, after which she did not have another relationship. She raised her children by herself. She is a very attentive mother. She tried with all her strength to make a good home for her children so that her children had comfortable lives and didn't want for anything or felt the absence of their father. Mukarram was both a father and a mother to her children.

Mukarram has sold goods at the market for several years in a row already. She sells vegetables, specifically yellow onions. Mukarram has a lot of experience in this field. She has sold at the market for more than 10 years. Over these long years, she has won dozens of loyal customers. As she herself says, "Thanks to my small business, I improved my family's lives and married off my daughter." Mukarram would like to expand her sale volume, as well as increase the variety of her assortment of vegetables. But the money she has already saved is not enough for a turnover of goods, which is why she is requesting a loan from Arvand in the hope that this organization will not refuse her and will assist her financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for retail sale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les sept  membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (aubergines, choux, tomates), charbon du bois, produits cosmétiques et du bois du charbon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme debout en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des condiments (aubergines, choux, tomates,  piments…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 corbeilles de tomate, 8 sacs d’aubergines, 6 sacs de choux  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djalakorodji à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokia compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly into monogamous households, the seven members of the Danaya group are, on average, 36 years old and have four children. They all live in Djalakorodji and know each other from neighborhood ties and from their businesses at the Djalakorodji market. The group members engage in small-scale commerce, selling condiments (eggplants, cabbage, tomatoes), charcoal, cosmetics and firewood.

In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan.

Rokia (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) sells condiments (eggplants, cabbage, tomatoes, peppers, etc.). She plans to use her loan to buy six baskets of tomatoes, eight sacs of eggplants, and six sacs of cabbage from Bamako.

Sales are made at retail in Djalakorodji to mostly women customers. 

With this loan, Rokia hopes to earn an average monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to meet the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Alakabo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe  ont en moyenne 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (maggi, tomates concentrées, sels iodés) maïs,  épiceries et du bois de chauffage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise au milieu  sur la photo) est une  vendeuse des condiments (maggi, tomates concentrées, sels iodés).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de iodés, 5 paquets de maggi et 4 cartons de tomates concentrées en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail  à Djalakorodji à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly into monogamous households, the five members of the group are, on average, 29 years old and have three children. They all live in Djalakorodji and know each other from neighborhood ties and from their businesses at the Djalakorodji market. The group members engage in small-scale commerce, selling condiments (e.g., Maggi, tomato paste, iodized salt), corn, groceries, and firewood. 

With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan.

Fatoumata (the woman seated in the middle of the photo) sells condiments (e.g., Maggi, tomato paste, iodized salt). She plans to use her loan to buy five bags of iodized salt, five packs of Maggi, and four boxes of tomato paste at wholesale form the large market.

Sales will be made at retail in Djalakorodji to mostly women customers. 

With her loan, Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to meet her household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
Higinio previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that he used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in his personal, household and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in his business. His profits from the business will definitely help sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Higinio hopes to have more customers and dreams to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and married with seven children. With one child currently in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. 

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Nuray is married and has two children. She's been working in Tupperware for three years. Her friend sold Tupperware and went to Nuray for sales. While learning the details of the job, Nuray could buy the products she needed at lower prices and support herself. She decided to do this job to earn her own money. She has sold Tupperware for three years, and sales are very good. She will buy goods with this loan. Her earnings support both her and her children. In the future she aspires to open and operate her own business. "I believe it will happen one day because I know I am a driven and successful person," she said. She also wants to send her children to university so they'll have careers and reach high positions. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
 Nuray Hanım,  evli iki çocuk annesi.  Üç senedir  tupperware  işi yapıyor.  Arkadaşı  tupperware satıyor ve satış için Nuray Hanıma gidiyor.  Nuray Hanım işin detaylarını da öğrenince hem kendi ihtiyacı olan ürünleri ucuza almak hem de kendi ayaklarının üzerinde durmak ,kendi parasını kazanmak için bu işi yapmaya karar veriyor  ve başlıyor.  Üç senedir tupperware  satıcısı.  Satışları çok iyi.  Bu kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Kazancı ile hem kendi hem de çocuklarının ihtiyacını karşılıyor.  Gelecekteki  hayali kendine ait bir iş yeri açmak ve işletmek.”Hırslı ve başarılı bir kişiliğim olduğunu bildiğimden bir gün olacağına inanıyorum”diyor.  Bir hayali de çocuklarını okutup meslek sahibi yapmak ,yüksek mevkiler de görmek.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca , una mujer emprendedora , tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y vive con el esposo y una  hija actualmente, ella solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, ella desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que tiene  esta señora  es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Blanca, who is 53 and married, is a very enterprising woman. She currently lives with her husband and a daughter. She is asking for a loan as she wants to buy supplies such as fertiliser and fumigants. She wants to help her coffee crop grow by keeping it in good condition so as to obtain a better quality product. The only thing holding her back is the lack of money to continue expanding. Since they depend on this economic activity to make a living, a loan has been requested, and it is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not asked for other loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR is offering a loan with better conditions and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and fumigants.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguignouma est composé de femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, draps de lit, d’habits et d’encens. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (femme assise à l’extrême  droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente d’encens de meilleures qualités. Très sollicitée pendant les périodes de mariage dans le quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2kg de magnonkissèni, un carton d’eau de Cologne et 3 bouteilles de parfums de qualité au grand marché. Pour faire de l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkissèni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant au moins 2 semaines puis on l’assaisonne avec des parfums. Ce produit ainsi obtenu avec des odeurs impeccables est prête à la vente en détail et à crédit au marché et parfois en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ami espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume.
texts.en:
The Djiguignouma group is made up of married women who live mostly in polygamous households. They are, on average, 30 years old and have four children. They all live in Banconi, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako, and they know each other from neighborhood ties.

The group members engage in small-scale commerce selling bed linens, clothing, and incense.

In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Ami (the woman seated on the far right in the photo) has a reputation of selling the best quality incense. She is very sought after during the marriage season in the neighborhood.

With her loan, she plans to buy two kilograms of magnonkisseni (seeds of wild, exotic plants), one carton of eau de cologne, and three bottles of quality parfumes from the grand market. To make incense, one imbibes the magnonkisseni in the eau de cologne for at least two weeks. Then, it is infused with the perfumes. This results in a perfect scent. After this, the incense is ready to sell at retail and for credit in the market and sometimes by traveling around to mostly female customers.

With this loan, Ami hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business in order to increase her capacity.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé des femmes mariées vivant  avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités, condiments, charbon de bois, huiles d’arachide et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une  réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à Djalakorodji  et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sitan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group is made up of married woman living with their husbands and their children in traditional families. They are, on average, 48 years old and have eight children. They all live in Djalakorodji and know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. 

The group members engage in small-scale commerce, selling high quality clothing (wax pagnes), condiments, charcoal, and groundnut oil. In order to increase they business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Sitan (the woman seated on the far left in the photo) has a reputation of selling high quality clothing (wax pagnes). She plans to use her loan to buy 20 lengths of wax pagne at wholesale from the grand market. 

Sales will be made at retail in Djalakorodji and surrounds to mostly female customers. 

With her loan, Sitan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta earns an income by running a kiosk business. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is grateful for her kiosk because it allows her to generate necessary income to support her family. Norberta is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000, which she will use to improve her business. She will use the loan funds to purchase a machine with which to mill corn and rice to offer for sale. 

She is happy to be receiving this loan because improving her business will allow her to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a machine with which to mill corn and rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros offers transportation services to earn a living. She previously accessed a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for her tricycle unit as well as to pay for its maintenance. Her increased earnings were a big help in meeting her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 18,000 loan in order to buy more spare parts and pay for further maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her improved profits will help her to better sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros dreams of eventually having additional tricycle units and hopes to have a better standard of living.  

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. At that time, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle unit as well as to pay for its maintenance

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 51 years old and has three children.  She is married and has two children who are in school. Isabelita is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her farm.

Isabelita has been farming sugarcane for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Francisca is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a candle vending business in the Philippines. Francisca has been in this business for five years. 

Francisca requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more candles to sell to her customers.

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more candles to sell to her customers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Imelda is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Imelda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, laundry soap, and snack foods.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Imelda has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, laundry soap, and snack foods.

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory, age 47, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of grocery items such as snack foods and canned goods.

Dory and her husband have three children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

She has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, Dory would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Amartsengel

texts.en:
Amartsengel, age 44, has been working as bookkeeper since 2008. Her husband offers taxi services to the local people. Their children both go to high school. The family lives in Kherlen, in the eastern province of Mongolia. 

She used part of her previous loan to pay for her mother's treatment because her mother was nearly on the verge of death. She also built the general framework for her house. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of 2240 USD, which she will use to buy necessary building materials such as bricks, cement, and planks. As a result, her family will live in a warm and comfortable place where less coal is burned, resulting in fewer pollutants being released into the air. 

This borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials for completing her house, such as bricks, cement, and planks

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is 25 years old, married, and has two young children. His family lives in Amulung. 

Romel is a fisherman, catching fish to sell. His wife operates a retail store, selling grocery items. 

Romel is now asking for PHP 5,000 to revolve in their businesses. He will buy fish net for fishing and grocery items (such as sardines, noodles, eggs, biscuits, and soap) to sell. It will help increase their income. 

With good profits in their businesses, they will achieve a better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to buy fish net for fishing and grocery items for the store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda has been running a general store for a living. With the revenue generated from the business, she has successfully repaid her previous loan.

In addition to the general store, she also raises pigs to sell. She has five piglets to raise. She took a new loan to buy feed for the piglets. She is happy with her business because she knows that it is improving. She wants to improve her standard of living and provide a better education for her child.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando has been selling dried fish for years to make a living. With the help of his wife, he was able to sustain it and able to provide for the family.

Aside from this, he has a farm growing bananas, their main source of income. With his revenue, he was able to repay his previous loan successfully. He hopes to sustain his business and be able to own a stall in the market where he can sell his fish. 

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC to cover weeding maintenance costs for the farm. 

He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover weeding maintenance costs for the farm

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 53 years old, married, and a mother with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Enriqueta has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Enriqueta has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn has been in this business for 25 years now.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosenda works hard to support her family.

She has an electronics repair business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Rosenda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her electronics repair business.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Recardina

texts.en:
Recardina is  taking a loan of $600 to improve her business.

She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital $400. She is running the kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, bread, candles, fish, coffee, sugar and body lotion.

She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To  buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, bread, candles, fish, coffee, sugar and body lotion

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with three children.  Mary Jane is 40 years old, and has one child who is still in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur; she has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Jane has been in this business for five years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 46 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nena runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nena has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, coffee, milk, juice, etc. 

Nena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is 38 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricor is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricor has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Silveriana

texts.en:
