Silveriana is a vegetable vendor. She earns an additional income from operating a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

Silveriana and her husband have three children, and she works hard to support her family.

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to offer for sale to her customers.

Silveriana hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 62 years old and married. Susan is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Susan requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Jerol

texts.en:
Jerol, age 24, raises and sells hogs to earn an income. He has been engaged in this work for the past two years. He is unmarried and lives with his parents, and he uses his income to help support the family. They live in Amulung. 

Jerold is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy feed and medicine for his hogs. This will allow them to attain a good weight and bring a higher price. 

He promises to repay his loan and continue to attempt to achieve his goal, which is to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for his hogs

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима умелая мастерица и вышивальщица золотом. Ей 36 лет. Она на протяжении 5 лет занимается вышивальным делом. Она любит свое ремесло и не представляет себя в другой профессии. Все работы Фотимы получаются красиво, поэтому ее труд всегда в спросе. Фотима занимается данным делом у себя дома. Она живет в городке Турсунзаде, с мужем и тремя детьми. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить ткани и нитки для золотой вышивки. Благодаря кредиту она сможет продолжить свою деятельность и брать больше заказов.
texts.en: Fotima is a skilled craftsperson and embroiderer in gold. She is 36 years old. She has been in the embroidery business for five years. She loves her trade and could not imagine herself in a different profession. All of Fotima's work turns out beautifully, which is why her services are always in demand. Fotima does this business in her home. She lives in the town of Tursun-zoda with her husband and three children. Now she is requesting a loan in order to buy fabric and thread for embroidery in gold. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to continue her business and take more orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for gold embroidery.

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maria Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal sales.  

Maria Lorena is borrowing 5,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia, age 63 and widowed with six children, runs a general store to earn an income. Adelia has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising chickens. Adelia works hard to provide for her family. 

She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale.

Adelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Haidilita

texts.en:
Haidilita has been helping her husband work on their own farm to make a living. For more than seven years, the couple has earned well.

Her previous loan used for the farm was successfully repaid with her revenue. She is hopeful that with this investment, she will gain a better and an abundant return for the family.  

To improve the farm, she took a new loan to cover replanting and fertilization costs for the farm. 

In the future, Haidilita wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to cover replanting and fertilization costs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling recyclable materials in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more recyclable materials to sell for her recyclable materials business. 

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Bagaim

texts.ru: Багаим 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Багаим - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Багаим занимается полеводством, стартовав 27 лет назад, с 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Багаим, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1,17 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает хлопок и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Багаим обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку семян хлопка и семян кукурузы для посевных работ. Доходы от кредита Багаим планирует вложить в развитие сельского хозяйства.
texts.en: Bagaim is 51 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising five children. Bagaim has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Bagaim practices crop farming. She started this business 27 years ago with 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bagaim's hard work, she currently has a 1.17 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows cotton and corn for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly earnings are 11,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Bagaim turned to Microcredit Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cotton seeds and corn seeds for sowing. Bagaim plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the development of her agriculture business.

loans.use: to buy cotton seeds and corn seeds.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau, 27, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Giau and his wife support their family by running a general store. He started this store seven years ago. 

Giau is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock his stall. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest into his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy household items and soft drinks

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel, age 54, runs a general store to earn an income. She offers such items as canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, cereals, and coffee for sale in her store. She has been in this business for three years. 

Isabel and her husband have two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Isabel has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale.
 
In the future, Isabel would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase such items as canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, cereals, and coffee to offer for sale

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Corazon has been farming sugarcane for twelve years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Corazon is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizers and to pay for the cultivation of her sugarcane field.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for the cultivation of her sugarcane field.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda, age 39, fattens and sells pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this work for four years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school.

Wenefreda has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane operates an Internet cafe to earn a living. She earns an additional income from running a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF.

Mary Jane and her husband have four children, and she works hard to support her family.

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her Internet cafe business.

Mary Jane hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her Internet cafe business

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жылдызкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jyldyzkan is 29 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Jyldyzkan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Jyldyzkan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 12 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jyldyzkan's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 5 goats on her farm. Her monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Jyldyzkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy a cow to increase the size of her herd. Jyldyzkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a small food stall where she sells pancakes and cold drinks.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy pancake ingredients and cold drinks needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marcelina dreams to be successful in all her businesses, and hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week.  She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pancake ingredients and cold drinks needed in her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Analiza has been in this business for 2 years now.

Analiza requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Analiza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gulsada

texts.ru: Гулсада 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулсады - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулсада занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 2 нетели, также имеется 1,64 ГА поливной земли, где в основном сажают фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсада планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulsada is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Gulsada has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Gulsada practices livestock breeding. She started this business 19 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulsada's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 20 sheep and 2 heifers on her farm, as well as a 1.54 hectare plot of irrigated land where she mainly plants beans. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulsada turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Gulsada plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosalia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional gear and materials for her business, like fishing net.

Rosalia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gear and materials for her business, like fishing net.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna, age 55, runs a general store where she offers such items as soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, bath soap, and toothpaste for sale.  She has been engaged in this business for five years. 

Erna and her husband have two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Erna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy such items as soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, bath soap, and toothpaste to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending.  

Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nona

texts.en:
Ma. Nona is 45 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Ma. Nona is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Nona has been farming sugarcane for five years, and also earns an additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn is 43 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school. Jeanilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additonal nipa roofing to sell.

Jeanilyn has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Jeanilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гульзаде 57 лет, вдова, супруг скоропостижно скончался в 1999 году, с тех пор одна воспитывает 4 детей. У Толгонай - средне-специальное образование, она работает медсестрой в местной больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гульзада занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 38 лет назад, с 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульзады, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь, 10 овец, также имеется 1,92 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупныЙ доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульзада обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа минеральных удобрений, селитры и аммофоса для обработки земли. Гульзада намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Гульзада планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Gulzada is 57 years old and a widow. Her husband died suddenly in 1999. Since then, she has been raising her four children by herself. Gulzada has a secondary-specialized education. She works as a nurse at a local hospital. As an additional source of income for her family, Gulzada practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 38 years ago with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulzada's hard work, she currently has 1 horse and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.92 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans every year for personal consumption and sale. Her cumulative monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulzada turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, saltpeter fertilizers and ammonium phosphate fertilizers to till her land. Gulzada is determined to receive a good harvest, which will fundamentally contribute to increasing her family's capital. Gulzada plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, saltpeter fertilizers and ammonium phosphate fertilizers.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of dried fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 30,000 PHP, to pay for dried fish she needs in her business. The more dried fish displayed at her stall, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Valeriana hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. Erma is married and has a retail firewood business in the Philippines.

Erma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell.

Erma has been in this business for eight years.

Erma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. May is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

May has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a hog grower living in Amulung with her family. She is 37 years old and had two children. She sells hogs to butchers in their village. 

Aside from raising hogs, she also buys and sells vegetables for additional income. 

She is now asking PHP 5,000 to invest in buying feed and medicines for the hogs. She will also buy additional vegetables (tomatoes, cabbages, eggplant) to sell.  

In the future, Jasmin hopes to keep achieving profitable income and save funds for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for the hogs, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear. 

Josephine is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more packs of medicines to sell for her buy and sell medicines business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her obtain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of medicines to sell

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jerlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a farming nipa business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Jerlyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries for the harvest of nipa leaves for her farming nipa  business.

Jerlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her obtain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pays for laborer's salaries for the harvest of nipa leaves

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Анаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 30 овец, 2 нетели а также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,64 ГА на котором ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение внука.
texts.en: Anarkan is 49 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising one son. Anarkan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Anarkan practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 19 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Anarkan's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 30 sheep and 2 heifers on her farm, as well as a 2.64 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans every year for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Anarkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Anarkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her granson's education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Enkhchimegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhchimegmaa, 34 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been running a tailoring workshop for six years. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their elder two daughters both go to high school, while the youngest son is educated at kindergarten. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,250 USD to buy textiles in large quantities as she got a request from a clothing retail store. 

As a result, she can continue to make and supply clothes to retailers without worrying about inventory shortages. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: To buy textiles in large quantities

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional eggs and salted eggs needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional eggs and salted eggs needed for her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to have other sources of income, and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional eggs and salted eggs needed for her business.

loans.name: Orzijon

texts.ru: Орзижон 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Орзижон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Орзижон занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Орзижон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орзижон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Орзижон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Orzijon is 44 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising six children. Orzijon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Orzijon practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Orzijon's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Orzijon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to fatten up and resell at the market for a high price. Orzijon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 38 years old and married with one child.

Jesusa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jesusa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jesusa aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Annalee

texts.en:
Annalee is 31 years old and married with one child.

Annalee works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like facial wash, toothpaste, canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Annalee has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load (mobile phone credit) retailing.

Annalee aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like facial wash, toothpaste, canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Concepcion is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Concepcion has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, a lamp, wood, etc. for her business.

Concepcion has been in this business for 18 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, a lamp, wood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa works hard to support her family. Luisa is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 60-years-old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bread, eggs, etc. to sell to her customers.

Lilia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, eggs, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josei

texts.en:
Josei is 41 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 60,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Josei has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending. Josei aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable vending business.

Anecita has been in this business for 9 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase addinational sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pension house business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase materials and tools for the maintenance of her pension house business.

Florita has been in this business for five years. Florita earns more income from buying and selling furniture.

Florita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for four years.

In the future Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Lupa

texts.en:
Lupa is a married entrepreneur with four children who operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, her husband does farming, their main source of income. For thirteen years in running the business and in farming, Lupa has earned well to support the needs of her family and was able to sustain her business.  

Lupa borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 41-years-old and married with two children. With two children in school, Maria Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like soft drinks, fabric conditioner, canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, milk, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, fabric conditioner, canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, milk, etc. 

In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soft drinks, fabric conditioner, canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 45 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Merlyn has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 49 years old and has one child.  She is widowed and her child is still in school.

Nila is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nila has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Nila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana tiene una edad de 54 años, con un grado de educación de primaria incompleta la cual no pudo terminar ya que en su familia por la falta de apoyo económico no pudieron sus padres apoyarle cursando únicamente hasta su 5 año. Ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes son mayores y están en hogares a parte viviendo únicamente en compañía de su madre. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa siendo ella quien se encargue de los diferentes trabajos en el campo como el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café: aplicación de abono, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros que ayudan a dar protección y mantenimiento ya que desde muy temprana edad en compañía de sus padres aprendió a desarrollar dichas actividades. La tierra que trabaja es propia la cual está ubicada a 5 minutos de camino a la cual se traslada caminando desde su casa de habitación.
Sus metas lograr ser una de las más fuertes productoras de café de la zona y así heredar la tierra que hoy en día trabaja a su familia. Fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y que sean ellos quienes sigan trabajando la tierra mejorando cada día más su situación y mediante esto sus ingresos. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayuden y contribuyan con el mejoramiento continuo de sus cultivos de café ya que sus ingresos dependen únicamente de este rubro por lo que tiene que mantener sus cultivos protegidos esperando ser apoyada para comprar lo que ella necesita.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old. She did not complete primary education due to a lack of economic support in her family. Her parents could only support her studies until her 5th year. She is a single mother of 2 children who are of legal age and who only live at home with their mother part-time. She is a farmer and a homemaker who is responsible for various field jobs, such as maintaining her coffee plants, applying fertilizer, and others that help protect and maintain them. From a very early age she learned to develop such activities from her parents. She works on her own land, which is located 5 minutes by foot from her house.

Her goals are to become one of the strongest coffee producing areas and thus inherit the land on which her family now works, and to reinforce patrimony for her children and that they continue to work on the land, and to improve their situation more and more each day through her income. Thus, she is now requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies to help and contribute to the continuous improvement of her coffee plants, as her income solely depends on this item. For this reason, she needs to keep her crops protected in the hopes of being supported in buying what she needs.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies to support and maintain her coffee plants

loans.name: Noren

texts.en:
Noren is 51-years-old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, coffee, etc.

Noren has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro mayor de edad soltera, originaria del municipio de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país,lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona muy productiva comercialmente,Socorro se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para salir adelante y obtener mejores ingresos, se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa nueva y cosméticos como pantalones jeans, faldas, blusas, short, camisas, ropa de cama, ropa de niño jugos de toallas, perfumes, labiales, rubor, sombra de ojos, lápiz delineador, marbelline y por las noches realiza deliciosas comidas rápidas como: tacos, gallo pinto, carne asada, pollo asado, maduros fritos con queso, tortitas de carne, tajadas, y los fines de semana deliciosas sopas de res con punche, gallina con albóndigas entre otras, sus compras las realiza en mercados y distribuidas de este misma localidad, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, en ocasiones da al crédito recuperando semanal. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo para la realización de sus deliciosas comidas al igual que en la compra de mercadería como: zapatos, ropa, cosméticos, entre otros. Socorro esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Socorro is a single, mature-aged woman from the municipality of Chinandega. This municipality, located in the west, is known to be a very productive commercial zone. Socorro is a responsible, hardworking woman with dreams of improving herself.

Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, she was not able to pursue a university degree and she has worked from an early age. Currently, she fights every day to move forward and earn a better income. She makes a living buying and selling general merchandise like jeans, skirts, blouses, shorts, shirts, pajamas, children's clothing, towel sets, perfumes, lipstick, blush, eye shadow, lip liner, and mascara. At night, she makes delicious prepared food, such as tacos, rice and beans, grilled steak, grilled chicken, fried plantains with cheese, small pancakes, and other small plates. On the weekends, she prepares delicious beef soups and chicken with meatballs among other dishes.

She makes her purchases in markets and distributes in the same neighborhood. She has regular and occasional customers and makes weekly loan payments. The objective of her new loan is to invest in capital for her work in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her delicious meals as well as the purchase of merchandise like clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other things. Socorro is very grateful for the support that Kiva investors offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy consumption goods such as meat, oil, tortillas, cheese, plantains, fruits and vegetables along with general merchandise like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics among other things.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 29 years now.

Rosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sinignesigui Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Sinignesigui ont en moyenne 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djelibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce des produits d’artisanaux (calebasses décorées, escabeaux, mortiers,…), d’habits, poissons, d’oignon, de la cola et de la pomme de terre. Dans le but de pérenniser leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de calebasses décorées, escabeaux, mortiers décorées ou gravées avec de belles figures géométriques,….. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  25 escabeaux, 20 calebasses décorées et 15 mortiers en gros avec les forgerons du quartier Mali de Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fanta compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the four members of the group called Sinignesigui have an average age of 50 and four children, on average. They all live in Djelibougou, a district of the town of Bamako, and met through ties of neighborhood and through their money-earning activities at the market of Djelibougou. 

The members of the group have small businesses selling crafts (decorated gourds, stools, mortars, etc.), clothing, fish, onions, kola and potatoes. Wishing to make their small businesses sustainable, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. 

Madame Fanta (the woman sitting on the far right in the photo) sells a lot of decorated gourds, stools, and mortars that are decorated or engraved with beautiful geometric shapes, etc. She intends to use her loan to buy 25 stools,  20 decorated gourds and 15 mortars wholesale from the blacksmiths in the district Mali in Bamako. She will resell them by the piece at the market to a clientele composed mainly of women. 

From this loan, Madame Fanta expects to have a monthly average profit of 80,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to cover her household's small necessities.

loans.use: to buy stools, mortars, and engraved or decorated gourds.

loans.name: Quenelyn

texts.en:
Quenelyn is a hardworking 19-year-old lady. She is studying at a university earning a BS in Business Administration. 

Quenelyn has four siblings and as a sister, she is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and love of her family. Her father works as mason in construction and her mother is the one taking care of all the household chores.

She is requesting this loan to pay her school tuition fees. Her goal is to find a better career and encourage her siblings to continue studying and so they can earn a  better income on their own.  In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 56-years-old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Julie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Julie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernardina is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Bernardina has a general store business in the Philippines. Bernardina requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Bernardina has been in this business for 5 years. Bernardina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine works hard to support her family. Catherine is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Catherine requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, meat, rice, spices, fish, eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

Catherine has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Princesita

texts.en:
Princesita is 33-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Princesita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional seedlings to sell.

Princesita has been farming vegetables for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings to sell

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta works hard to support her family. Marta is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like paint, wood, etc. for a new fishing boat.

Marta has been in this business for eight years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like paint, wood, etc. for a new fishing boat

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 53-years-old and married with nine children.

Emeliana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop and fish vending.

Emeliana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (concombres, betteraves et tomates), riz et charbon du bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marama (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de légumes, (concombres, betteraves, oignons et tomates).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500kg d’oignon, 4 corbeilles de tomate, 5 sacs de concombre et 3 corbeilles de betterave au marché. La revente se fait en détail au Banconi à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Marama compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in polygamous households, the five members of this Sabougnouma group are on average 42 and have an average of five children. They all live in Banconi, one of the districts of the town of Bamako, and they met through bonds of neighborhood and through their money-earning activities at the market of Branconi. 

The members of the group have small businesses selling vegetables (cucumbers, beets and tomatoes), rice and charcoal. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso  and are on their third solidarity loan. 

Madame Marama (the woman seated in the middle of the photo) sells a lot of vegetables (cucumbers, beets, onions and tomatoes). She intends to use her loan to buy 500 kg of onions, four baskets of tomatoes, five sacks of cucumbers, and three baskets of beets at the market. The vegetables will be sold retail at Banconi to a clientele composed mostly of women. With this loan, Madame Marama expects to have an average monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to cover small necessities for her household.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net.

Rufina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Elmer Evelio

texts.es: Elmer, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo y reside en la comunidad de Olanchito, Yoro con su esposa e hijo. Elmer decidió con su esposa establecer su propio negocio de pulpería desde hace 9 años, vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, manteca, jabón, pastas, condimentos, aceite, churros, jugos, dulces etc. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y es el tercer ciclo, el cual va invertir en surtir de productos como ser granos básicos, carnes, golosinas, refrescos, jugos y otros que necesite para mantener el inventario. Su plan es sostener el negocio para darle buena educación a su hijo
texts.en: Elmer is 34 years old, married, has a son, and lives in the village of Olanchito, Yoro, with his wife and son. Elmer decided to open his own grocery store with his spouse 9 years ago. He sells basic family goods such as rice, beans, meat, sausages, soft drinks, butter, soap, pasta, spices, oil, churros, juices, sweets, etc. This business is his source of income to support his family. The loan that he is requesting is for 15,000 HNL and is the third cycle, which will invest in products such as basic grains, meat, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and others that he needs to keep inventory. His plan is to sustain the business to give his son a good education.

loans.use: supply his business of products such as basic grains, meat, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and others that he needs to keep inventory.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 38-years-old and single. 

She has an electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional amounts of electronic mobile load to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of electronic mobile load to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is single and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Judith has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en: Mesalimu appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support that improved her living standards and earned her a higher income.  She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more stock of fish.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish

loans.name: Siria Walterina

texts.es: Siria, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Olanchito, Yoro con su familia. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, vende comidas como desayunos, almuerzos, refrescos y también vende verduras. Este negocio lo tiene en un local del mercado. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 21,000 Lempiras para mejorar el negocio, va comprar mesas y sillas para atender mejor la clientela. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Siria is 37 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in the village of Olanchito, Yoro, with her family. She has always been involved with business. She sells breakfast food, lunch food, soft drinks, and vegetables. Her business is located in a local market. She has decided to apply for a loan of 21,000 HNL to improve her business. She will buy tables and chairs to better serve her customers. Her goal is to grow her business and give her family a better life.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for her business and to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Fotemogoban sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 52 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Banconi dans le district de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, jarres, charbons du bois, sacs à main et bois de chauffage. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mama (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de beaux produits de la poterie. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400 jarres et 50 encensoirs avec les forains de Ségou et de Mopti.  La revente se fait au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mama  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the group called Fotemogoban are married, mostly in monogamous households. They are 52 on average and have three children. They all live in the Branconi neighborhood in the district of Bamako. They met because of ties of neighborhood and through their money-earning activities at the market of Branconi. 

The members of the group have small businesses selling jars, charcoal, handbags, and firewood. Wishing to pay cash when they stock up on goods, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. 

Madame Mama (the woman seated in the middle in the photo) has a good reputation as a seller of beautiful pieces of pottery. She intends to use her loan to buy 400 jars and 50 incense burners from the traveling merchants from Ségou and Mopti.  They will be sold at the market to a clientele composed mainly of women. With this loan, Madame Mama  hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in the activity and cover healthcare expenses for the children.

loans.use: to buy pottery jars and incense burners

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Judith has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, juice, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Doña Sandra es una señora activa que vende frijoles cocidos, pan y los fines de semana realiza nacatamales para vender en su casa, mientras su esposo sale a trabajar como albañil. Actualmente tiene la necesidad de levantar un muro perimetral de la parte posterior de su vivienda para asegurar su hogar, ya que la zona donde habita es bien concurrida por los delincuentes.
texts.en:
Sandra is an active woman who sells cooked beans and bread. On the weekends she makes tamales that she sells from home while her husband goes out to work as a bricklayer. 

At this time she needs to put up a wall around her house for safety, because there are many criminals in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, steel,and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Anely

texts.en:
Anely is 25-years-old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling cultured pearls in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of cultured pearls to sell.

Anely has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Julie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell business with ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure service. Julie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear to stock and sell

loans.name: Nodis Indira

texts.es: Nodis, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en una comunidad de Olanchito, Yoro con sus hijos. Ella lleva tres años de haber decidido por su propio negocio donde vende variedad de comidas rápidas, golosinas como churros, dulces, galletas y refrescos. Tiene un puesto de venta enfrente a una escuela. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio de productos como refrescos, churros, dulces, galletas, insumos para hacer comidas y poder mantener productos suficientes para vender. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y darles mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Nodis is 36 years old, a single mother of two children, and lives in the village of Olanchito, Yoro, with her children. She opened her own business three years ago, where she sells a variety of snack food, sweets such as churros, candy, cookies, and soft drinks. She has a stall opposite from a school. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to stock her business with products such as soft drinks, churros, sweets, cookies, and supplies to make food and so that she may sell products. Her plan is to grow her business and give her children a better life.

loans.use: Stock her business with products such as soft drinks, churros, sweets, cookies, and supplies to make and sell food.

loans.name: Milma

texts.en:
Milma is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Milma is 37 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Milma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and gallons of gasoline.

Milma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and gallons of gasoline

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lilian has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from handicrafts.

Lilian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 33 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marilyn has a handicrafts business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her handicrafts business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en un sector que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva café y hortalizas como rábano, chiles, repollo y tomates. La producción la vende en los mercados del municipio. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y los utilizara en la compra de insumos como fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de café. Su meta es mejorar la producción, para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old, married with three children, and lives in an area in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. He has spent his whole life working in agriculture, growing coffee, and vegetables such as radishes, chiles, cabbage and tomatoes. He sells his products in the municipal markets.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras which he will use to buy supplies such as fertilizer to take care of his coffee crop.  His goal is to increase production so his children can get a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer to care for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman, she has five children, three of whom attend school, one adult, and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanalima has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ma. Connie

texts.en:
Ma. Connie is 48 years old and married with 3 children.

Ma. Connie is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Connie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Connie has been farming sugarcane for ten years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her sugarcane farm

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, 47 years old, married and lives with her husband. To have additional income she is engaged in a hog raising business. Adelaida loves to raise animals. She is a very caring person, most especially with her family. She makes sure that she can meet all the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan amounting Php 18,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her business. 

In the future Adelaida hopes that she can expand her business so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Rosa Carmelina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, su otro hijo aunque es mayor de edad   aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Rosa realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, para ellos la situación se les puso muy difícil hace años atrás ya que tenían un  carro en el cual su marido se encargaba de comprar sus productos y luego distribuirlos por las comunidades vecinas, pero a ellos los asaltaron y les robaron el carro el cual nunca recuperaron,  gracias a los créditos ellos pudieron continuar con el negocio el cual de a poco les ha ido ayudando a salir adelante, actualmente el realiza su actividad en un carro que fleta para poder vender sus productos. Con esta actividad el logra llevar el pan diario a su mesa que es lo mas importante.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para que su marido venda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito casi desde el inicio y le gusta por el apoyo que siempre le han brindado. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su marido realice sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” group meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and for its grand art forms, such as the straw hats known within and outside the country.

Rosa lives here.  She is 48 years old, married, and had two children but one passed away.  Her other son still lives with her even though he is an adult.  Her husband is a merchant. 

Rosa is asking for this loan for her husband who sells fruits and vegetables.  Things got very difficult for them two years ago.  They had a car that her husband used to pick up their products and deliver them to the neighboring communities, but they were robbed and the car was stolen and never recovered.  Thanks to the loans, they were able to continue with their business which has helped them to get ahead little by little.  Now sells his products without a car.  They are able to bring home their daily bread, which is most important, through this activity.

This loan is to buy vegetables for her husband to sell.  She has been a part of the communal bank almost since the beginning and she likes it because it has always been supportive.  Her dreams are to buy a car so that her husband can make his sales.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, fish, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years now and earns additional income from a general store.

Marivic would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, fish, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 36 yeasts old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mirasol has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Mirasol requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc. for her business.

Mirasol has been in this business for 7 years. Mirasol would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates Kiva lenders for her previous loan. She still sells fruit and vegetables.

She is requesting for a loan of Kshs.20,000 to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale and to pay school fees for her children.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables, and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Deysi  Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Deysi, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 9 y 3 años, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer de un bus de transporte.
Doña Deysi con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto contribuir con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa. Trabaja tres días por semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esas horas sus hijos están en la escuela, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería se la lleva un señor desde Huaquillas una vez al mes. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se ayudan para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y camisetas. Lleva como 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó con su negocio. Sus sueños es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” group meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and for its grand art forms, such as the straw hats known within and outside the country.

Deysi lives here.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children ages 13, 9, and 3.  The two older ones attend high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a bus driver.

Deysi sells all types of clothing door to door so that she can help with the household expenses.  She also sells out of her home and works three days a week, mainly in the mornings while her children are in school.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  A gentleman brings her merchandise to her from Huaquillas once a month.  She has been doing this for nine years and this helps her get ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, blouses, and shirts.  She has been with the group for 10 years and she likes it because she was able to start her business with her first loan.  Her dreams are for her children to need for nothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Eveshell

texts.en:
Eveshell is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living from a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Eveshell is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Eveshell has been in the business of pig fattening for 7 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is a 56-year-old mother who was gifted with two children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to financial insufficiency, she engages herself in providing manicure and pedicure services to have an additional source of income. To provide a better service, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP12,000 to buy the needed cosmetics, clipper, cuticle remover, nail polish and acetone. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business and provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies for her business

loans.name: Paola Katherine

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
