Doña Paola con su esposo tienen un local en el cual venden materiales de construcción,  su local es muy concurrido ya que no hay muchos lugares que vendan ese tipo de materiales, ahí sus clientes encuentran hierro, cemento, arena, piedra, ladrillos y muchos otros materiales que se necesitan en el campo de la construcción de viviendas, trabajan todos los días ya que no se le hace incomodo vender así sea los domingos ya que su negocio lo tienen en su casa. Son 3 años que tienen  su negocio por lo cual ya cuentan con buena clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar cemento, hierro y varios materiales de construcción más que les hacen falta. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos  son rápidos. Sus sueños es tener una gran ferretería.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” group meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and for its grand art forms, such as the straw hats known within and outside the country.

Paola lives here.  She is 24 years old, married and has a three year old son.  Her husband is a merchant.

Paola and her husband have a store where they sell building materials and the store is very well known since there are not many places that sell this type of material.  Their customers can buy iron bars, cement, sand, stones, bricks, and many other types of materials that they need in the home construction field.  They work every day and they don’t find it difficult to work on Sundays because their business is in their home, they have had the business for three years, and have good customers.

She will use the money from this loan to buy cement, iron bars, and various building materials that she needs.  She has been with the group for four cycles and likes it because the loans come quickly.  Her dreams are to have a large hardware store.

loans.use: to buy building materials for resale.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is 50 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Leonidas is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonidas requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Leonidas has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonidas would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 34-year-old married man. He has four children, ages ranging from 5 to 14 years. He describes himself to be determined. 

Ben operates a retail business where he sells cereals; he has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a high population area, and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Ben will use the Kes 98,000 loan to buy more cereal stock. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life and a cash flow that is continuous. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy more cereal stock.

loans.name: Rue

texts.en:
Rue is 48 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Rue is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and fish net for fencing.

Rue has been raising ducks for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising chickens and selling duck eggs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and fish net for fencing

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 35 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Arlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Arlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, rice, bread, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Arlyn has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future Arlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, rice, bread, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 40 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Jacqueline is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Jacqueline has been farming rice for four years, and also earns an additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 60 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. 

Rosalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

She has been raising cattle for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Nor's Group

texts.en:
Nor, 52, is a resident from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is in school. For her family, rice farming and cassava growing are the main source of her income. This business has returned her 43,000 KHR per day.  

This is the second microloan for Nor with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); it is the same cycle for her co-borrowers. In a group of three, Nor is the leader. The first loan, which she has fully repaid, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is the representative. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes that she can gain a better income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Melva engages in a hog raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 44 years old, and has three school age children. She and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will find a good job someday. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, Melva planned to acquire more pigs to raise. 

Having limited capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP18,000 to buy the said additional pigs, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs. 

Through patience and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida, is a 46 year old married woman from the village of Bagutari, province of Isabela. She is engaged in selling different products in the community. She loves her work because according to her she loves to meet other people and offer her products to them. To have additional income she is asking for a loan amounting Php 10,000 to buy perfume, clothes, umbrellas, shoes and dressws for her business. Zenaida hopes that her business expands so that she can build her own stall in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothes, umbrellas, shoes and dresses for her business

loans.name: Marjorie Katherine

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Marjorie, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 1 año, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Marjorie es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja tres días por semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que su mamá les cuida a sus hijos, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva tres años dedicada al comercio con el cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo en especial de temporada playera que es lo que más se vende. Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta ya que con los créditos compra al contado y así le queda más ganancias. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” group meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and for its grand art forms, such as the straw hats known within and outside the country.

Marjorie lives here.  She is 20 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 1.  The oldest is in kindergarten.  Her husband works as a driver.

Marjorie is a good wife who sells all types of clothing door to door and from her home.  She takes orders from her customers and works three days a week, but mainly in the morning when her mother takes care of her children.  She sells on credit and collects each weekend and buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been doing this for three years and gets ahead this way.

She will use the money from this loan to buy all types of clothing, especially beach season clothing, which is what she sells the most of.  She has been with the group for two years and likes it because she can buy in cash with the help of the loans and makes more profit this way.  Her dreams are to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 34, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a community worker, and they have children. She is working hard to continually provide for their everyday expenses.  She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business.

Evangeline operates a general merchandise business. She sells different items, from wood to ice and other products. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and is easily seen by customers. Her regular buyers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php900 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more charcoal, coconut, wood, ice and other products needed in her business.

Evangeline dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for charcoal, coconut, wood, ice and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 52 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Divina has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 1 year and also earns an income from a buy and sell vegetable business.

Divina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jemema

texts.en:
Jemema earns a living by selling dry goods. She earns an additional income from operating a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

Jemema and her husband have three children, and she works hard to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 12000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more items like perfume, umbrellas, and clothing for her dry goods business.

Jemema hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like perfume, umbrellas, and clothing for her dry goods business

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is a hardworking 52-year-old man who has worked on a farm for many years as his main source of income.  He is married and his wife works as teacher.  He also has seven children. 

Jeremias is someone who is very dedicated to God and to serving others.  He works in various roles such as farmer and laborer to move forward. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.  His goal is to continue working to allow his children to continue studying so that they prepare themselves to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 46-year-old married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as interactive. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are reliable customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: tp buy more stock of clothes to buy.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for one year and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Gertrudes requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business.

Gertrudes has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe works hard to support her family. She is married and has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 21 years now.

Cleofe requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cleofe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines that she has operated for 17 years.  She earns additional income from food vending.

Sonia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries for her general store business.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man who is very hardworking and enterprising. He lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

For the past 14 years, he has been selling cows and goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for his business has been unstable market prices. 

He joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to purchase more cows and goats for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and goats for his business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with three children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, salt, sugar, detergent soap, bath soap, bread, etc. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 51 years old and married with four children.

Amalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Amalia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Amalia aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 20 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

Noralyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from buying and selling native products and rice retailing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, abd eggs

loans.name: Elvia Beatriz

texts.es:
Elvia tiene 28 años de edad  de estado civil soltera vive con sus padres en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Elvia se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, y al engorde de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de  abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y producción en la venta de los chanchos. Su desafío es contar con un recurso económico. En su tiempo libre estudia y la costumbre que le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Elvia is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs), which is located 20 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office that operates in Guaranda. The group includes 10 members who are from the same community. They engage in agriculture.

Elvia is a farmer who grows corn, but she also raises pigs for fattening. She is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, insecticides, fertilizers, and fungicides. Her purchases will be made in Guaranda. Her goals include increasing the planting of her crops and produce more pigs to sell. Her challenge is accessing financial resources.

Elvia studies in her free time and she enjoys the custom known as Carnival.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fertilizers, and fungicides.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucara, una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores patos, gallinas y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is 25 years old and lives with her husband and children in the District of Pucara, a community that experiences a warm climate. The residents engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Rosmeri raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs in an area located behind her house. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN in order to buy balanced feed for fattening her animals. This will enable her to produce more animals that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a 34-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells eggs. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a favorable place, and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of eggs. His business goal is to own a company within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a stable life. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.  His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.  He will use the anticipated profits to start a wholesale business for selling eggs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs

loans.name: Marlene Estela

texts.es:
Marlene, tiene una pupusería que atiende 5:00 a.m. a  12:00 p.m., lo aprendió de su mamá, actualmente realiza dicha actividad para tener ingresos con los que apoya en los gastos de su familia. Marlene es casada, tiene un hijo de 14 años.
Para tener un inventario con la materia prima necesaria para su negocio necesita capital, por esa razón solicita la ayuda para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, harina, bebidas, aceite y gas propano, de esta forma se mantendré trabajando, tendrá más clientes, sus ventas mejoraran y sus ganancias aumentaran.
Sueña con tener una economía que le permita mejorar su vivienda y ofrecer un mejor estilo de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene has a “pupusería” (a shop that sells stuffed tortillas) that she operates from 5:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M. She learned this trade from her mother. Her business currently generates income so that she help with her family’s expenses. Marlene is married and has a 14-year-old son.

In order to have an inventory of needed supplies for her business, Marlene must have capital. For this reason, she is requesting assistance so that she can buy cheese, pork skins, flour, beverages, oil, and propane gas in order to keep working. This will enable her to attract more customers, increase her sales, and generate more revenue.

Marlene dreams of being in a financial condition in which she can improve her home and provide a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork skins, flour, beverages, oil, and propane gas.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: To have additional income, Emma is engaged in the hog-raising business within her community. She is 62 years old and has three adult-age children. She aims to make her business profitable in order to satisfy their basic necessities and save some for future emergencies. Due to limited capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will further improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and pigs to raise

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el Caserío El Frayle, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia e Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, desde hace 25 años, su esposa le apoya con crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas y pago de mano de obra para el cultivo de su maíz y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daniel is 58 years old and lives with his wife and son in the village of El Frayle, a rural area in the District of Santo Tomás. This community has green pastures. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Daniel is a farmer who specializes in growing corn. He has been doing this for 25 years. His wife helps by raising and selling small animals in an area behind their home. Daniel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that he can buy seeds and pay for labor in order to plant corn. This will enable him to have better production so that he can offer his crops to his customers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Shalimar

texts.en: Shalimar is 45, married, and has two children in school.  To have an additional source of income, she plans to improve her duck-raising business in order to help her husband in financing the education of her children.  She plans to acquire more ducks to raise but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy the needed feed and additional ducks to raise.  Having patience and strong determination, she believes that someday she will improve the business and generate a higher income from it.

loans.use: to buy needed feed and additional ducks to raise

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Didith

texts.en:
Didith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for business.

Didith has been in this business for three years. Didith earns more income from buying and selling native products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elma works hard to support her family.

She has a farming of rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Elma is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer for her farming of rice business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Cecilia Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  su familia. Su negocio es el servicio de molino desde hace 5 años.
Doña Cecilia esto lo hace en su casa de habitación y debido a que es un lugar muy céntrico tiene muchos clientes. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para brindarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino. Con el préstamo espera que su negocio funcione de la mejor manera y así aumentar sus ingresos y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Cecilia espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio ya sea comprando otro molino, con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en cualquier problema económico que surja y de esta forma darse una mejor calidad de vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero del  2014
texts.en:
Sra. Cecilia is a hardworking and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. She has been providing milling services for five years.

Doña Cecilia operates her business from her home because it is centrally located in an area where she has many customers. She needs this loan in order to buy equipment for maintaining her grain mill. With this loan, she hopes that her business will function in the best way possible so that she can increase her earnings. By having more income, she will be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

In the short term, Doña Cecilia hopes to grow her business by purchasing another grain mill. This would allow her to continue supporting her family and providing them a better quality of life despite any financial problem that could arise.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2014

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her grain mill.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years. Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 40 years old, married and has three children. 

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jean has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Susan is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lucresio

texts.en: Lucresio has been providing transportation services in the community for more than three years. He earns well from this and from the snack vending done by his wife. Lucresio took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new tires to replace the old used tires. In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and save his profit to improve their life.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Ivan Julian

texts.es:
Iván tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive con su mamá en la comunidad de Joyocoto perteneciente al cantón Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Iván se dedica a la carpintería y al negocio de venta de ganados. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es terminar sus estudios. Su desafío es viajar a otro país. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, y la costumbre que le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Iván is 22 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the community of Joyocoto, which is part of the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs), which is located 20 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office that operates in Guaranda. The group includes 10 members who are from the same community. They engage in agriculture.

Iván is a carpenter who also has a business of selling livestock. He is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock. The animals will be purchased in Guaranda. His goal is to finish his studies. His challenge is being able to travel to another country.

Iván likes to play sports in his free time and he enjoys the custom known as Carnival.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, se ha decidido por solicitar más capital para tener los recursos económicos necesarios para comprar cerdos, pagar transporte y mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha, con  lo que podrá tenerla a disposición en menor tiempo tanto para consumo familiar y como para comercializarla, de esta manera tener los ingresos que necesita para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
El préstamo anterior le favoreció mucho ya que su cosecha fue abundante, combatió las plagas y sus ingresos son mejores, su familia mantiene el mismo número de miembros pero con mejores oportunidades de superación.
texts.en:
Teresa decided to request more capital so that she would have the necessary financial resources to buy pigs, pay for transport costs, and hire labor for gathering her harvest. She needs for this to happen quickly so that she can feed her family and have products to sell. This would enable her to generate income for covering the basic needs of her family.

Her previous loan resulted in favorable results since she was able to achieve an abundant harvest, fight off pests, and improve her earnings. Her family remains the same size, but they have had better opportunities to thrive.

loans.use: to buy pigs, pay for transport costs, and hire labor for gathering her harvest.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia believes that having "patience and strong determination" will enable her to achieve her goals in life. She is 52 years old and chose to be single. She is engaged in a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. To improve the business, she plans to acquire additional piglets to raise. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through this loan, she believes that someday she will be able to improve the business and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Nimurezi

texts.en:
Nimurezi is a widowed woman with six children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over six years, she has operated a fruit-and-vegetable-stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 61 years old, married and has three children.  

Norma and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Norma is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Norma has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her sari-sari (variety) store and hog raising.

With your help, Norma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family after Super Typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Maribeth is taking out a housing loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her buy and sell of chickens business.

With your help, Maribeth can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor
